quote: The doctor  if he forgets he is only the assistant to nature and zealously takes over the stage  may so add to what nature is already doing well that he actually throws the patient into shock by the vigour he adds to nature's forces.
author: Herbert Ratner

quote: God heals  and the doctor takes the fees.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The history of medicine is a story of amazing foolishness and amazing intelligence.
author: Jerome Tarshis

quote: If men could get pregnant  abortion would be a sacrament.
author: Florynce Kennedy

quote: Abortion is advocated only by persons who have themselves been born.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: Man should not strive to eliminate his complexes  but to get in accord with them  they are legitimately what directs his contact in the world.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: The body never lies.
author: Martha Graham

quote: All that is really necessary for survival of the fittest  it seems  is an interest in life  good  bad or peculiar.
author: Grace Paley

quote: The only thing to know is how to use your neurosis.
author: Arthur Adamov

quote: Common sense is in medicine the master workman.
author: Peter Latham

quote: The prime goal is to alleviate suffering  and not to prolong life. And if your treatment does not alleviate suffering  but only prolongs life  that treatment should be stopped.
author: Christian Barnard

quote: As long as men are liable to die and are desirous to live  a physician will be made fun of  but he will be well paid.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: After dinner  rest a while  after supper walk a mile.
author: Arabic proverb

quote: Imprisoned in every fat man  a thin one is wildly signalling to be let out.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Wherever a doctor cannot do good  he must be kept from doing harm.
author: Hippocrates

quote: The student is to collect and evaluate facts. The facts are locked up in the patient.
author: Abraham Flexner

quote: The practice of medicine is a thinker's art  the practice of surgery a plumber's.
author: Martin H. Fisher

quote: Every surgeon carries about him a little cemetery  in which from time to time he goes to pray  a cemetery of bitterness and regret  of which he seeks the reason for certain of his failures.
author: Rend Leriche

quote: Symptoms  then  are in reality nothing but the cry from suffering organs.
author: Jean-Martin Charcot

quote: I observe the physician with the same diligence as the disease.
author: John Donne

quote: The very first requirement in a hospital is that it should do the sick no harm.
author: Florence Nightingale

quote: There are some remedies worse than the disease.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Sickness is a sort of early old age  it teaches us a diffidence in our earthly state.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: To be sick is to enjoy monarchal prerogatives.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Every invalid is a physician.
author: Irish proverb

quote: 'Tis healthy to be sick sometimes.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Our doctor would never really operate unless it was necessary. He was just that way. If he didn't need the money  he wouldn't lay a hand on you.
author: Herb Shriner

quote: Physicians of the Utmost Fame were called at once  but when they came they answered  as they took their fees  'There is no cure for this disease.'
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: A good gulp of hot whisky at bedtime - it's not very scientific  but it helps.
author: Alexander D. Fleming

quote: I enjoy convalescence. It is the part that makes the illness worthwhile.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A general flavour of mild decay  but nothing local  as one may say.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: One of the first duties of the physician is to educate the masses not to take medicine.
author: William Osier

quote: I was sick  and ye visited me.
author: Bible

quote: There is a great difference between a good physician and a bad one  yet very little between a good one and none at all.
author: Arthur Young

quote: Nature  time and patience are the three great physicians.
author: Proverbs

quote: So many come to the sickroom thinking of themselves as men of science fighting disease and not as healers with a little knowledge helping nature to get a sick man well.
author: Sir Auckland Geddes

quote: No doctor takes pleasure in the health even of his friends.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: It requires a great deal of faith for a man to be cured by his own placebos.
author: John L. McClenahan

quote: It is very difficult to slow down. The practice of medicine is like the heart muscle's contraction - it's all or none.
author: Bela Schick

quote: Those in the United States who  by and large  have the best medical care and advice readily available to them at the least expense are the families of the specialists in internal medicine. These families use less medicine and undergo less surgery on the whole than any other group  rich or poor.
author: Edward C. Lambert

quote: Nothing is more fatal to health than an overcare of it.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Doctor  feel my purse.
author: Jane Ace

quote: The sorrow which has no vent in tears may make other organs weep.
author: Henry Maudsley

quote: There is some reason to believe there is greater safety in this branch of medicine from modest  unassuming ignorance  than from a meddling presumption which frequently accompanies a little learning.
author: Samuel Bard

quote: A person seldom falls sick but the bystanders are animated with a faint hope that he will die.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: In my youth  once  when I had a really exquisite toothache  I suddenly realized that my tooth had temporarily become the centre of the universe  that its outcries were more important than anything else  and that I would do absolutely anything to placate it. And as one gets older and starts worrying about cancer  one becomes more and more conscious of the fragility of the whole body  and with that consciousness comes a new and degrading kind of fear. It is degrading because it strengthens the desire to survive on any terms  and the desire to survive on any terms is the most base of all our instincts.
author: Otto Friedrich

quote: If a man thinks about his physical or moral state  he usually discovers that he is ill.
author: Goethe

quote: I reckon being ill is one of the greatest pleasures of life  provided one is not too ill and is not obliged to work till one is better.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: We are usually the best men when in the worst health.
author: English proverb

quote: Some of the papers presented at today's medical meeting tell us what we already know  but in a much more complicated manner.
author: Alphonse Raymond Dochez

quote: A human being who is first of all an invalid is all body  therein lies his inhumanity and his debasement.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Invalids live longest.
author: German proverb

quote: A vigorous five-mile walk will do more good for an unhappy but otherwise healthy adult than all the medicine and psychology in the world.
author: Paul Dudley White

quote: We firmly believe that therapy is education rather than healing  that it is growth rather than treatment.
author: Arnold Lazarus

quote: Ask many of us who are disabled what we would like in life and you would be surprised how few would say  'Not to be disabled.' We accept our limitations.
author: Itzhak Perlman

quote: What is dangerous about tranquillizers is that whatever peace of mind they bring is packaged peace of mind. Where you buy a pill and buy peace with it  you get conditioned to cheap solutions instead of deep ones.
author: Max Lerner

quote: The tongue ever turns to the aching tooth.
author: Proverbs

quote: So long as the body is affected through the mind  no audacious device  even of the most manifestly dishonest character  can fail of producing occasional good to those who yield to it an implicit or even a partial faith.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Tranquillizers do not change our environment  nor do they change our personalities. They merely reduce our responsiveness to stimuli. They dull the keen edge of the angers  fears  or anxiety with which we might otherwise react to the problems of living. Once the response has been dulled  the irritating surface noise of living muted or eliminated  the spark and brilliance are also gone.
author: Indra Devi

quote: I am in a moment of pretty wellness.
author: Horace Walpole

quote: Health is the thing that makes you feel that now is the best time of the year.
author: Franklin Pierce Adams

quote: When you hear hoofbeats  think of horses before zebras.
author: Harley S. Smyth

quote: The American Medical Association operating from a platform of negative vigilance presents no solutions but busily fights each change and then loudly supports it against the next proposal.
author: John H. Knowles

quote: When we are sick our virtues and our vices are in abeyance.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Most things get better by themselves. Most things  in fact  are better by morning.
author: Lewis Thomas

quote: In medicine  sins of commission are mortal  sins of omission venial.
author: Theodore Tronchin

quote: It is the duty of a doctor to prolong life and it is not his duty to prolong the act of dying.
author: Thomas, Lord Horder

quote: I came  I saw  I concurred.
author: Irvine H. Page

quote: Disease often tells its secrets in a casual parenthesis.
author: Wilfred Trotter

quote: The physician heals  Nature makes well.
author: Aristotle

quote: Nature  time  and patience are the three great physicians.
author: H. G. Bohn

quote: The best doctor is the one you run for and can't find.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: I find the medicine worse than the malady.
author: Beaumont and Fletcher

quote: An apple a day keeps the doctor away.
author: English proverb

quote: God heals and the doctor takes the fee.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: He's the best physician that knows the worthlessness of the most medicines.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: I firmly believe that if the whole materia medica as now used  could be sunk to the bottom of the sea  it would be all the better for mankind and all the worse for the fishes.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Physician  heal thyself.
author: Bible

quote: Doctors are men who prescribe medicines of which they know little  to cure diseases of which they know less  in human beings of whom they know nothing.
author: Voltaire

quote: A sound mind in a sound body is a thing to be prayed for.
author: Juvenal

quote: Goodnight! Goodnight! Parting is such sweet sorrow That I shall say goodnight 'til it be morrow.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Man's feelings are always purest and most glowing in the hour of meeting and of farewell.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: Visits always give pleasure - if not the arrival  the departure.
author: Portuguese proverb

quote: There's a kind of release And a kind of torment in every goodbye for every man.
author: C. Day Lewis

quote: Parting is all we know of heaven and all we need of hell.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: The joys of meeting pay the pangs of absence  else who could bear it?
author: Nicholas Rowe

quote: We only part to meet again.
author: John Gay

quote: Departure should be sudden.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: A feeling of sadness and longing that is not akin to pain  and resembles sorrow only as the mist resembles the rain.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: A little while with grief and laughter  And then the day will close  The shadows gather . . . what comes after No man knows.
author: Donald R. P. Marquis

quote: Forgetfulness transforms every occurrence into a non-occurrence.
author: Plutarch

quote: How is it that we remember the least triviality that happens to us  and yet not remember how often we have recounted it to the same person?
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: I never forgive  but I always forget.
author: Arthur James Balfour

quote: In memory  everything seems to happen to music.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Living in the past has one thing in its favour - it's cheaper.
author: Old saying

quote: Memory is the diary that we all carry about with us.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Reminiscences make one feel so deliciously aged and sad.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Memory  of all the powers of the mind  is the most delicate and frail.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: Gratitude is the heart's memory.
author: French proverb

quote: The true art of memory is the art of attention.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: A man must get a thing before he can forget it.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: It isn't so astonishing  the number of things that I can remember  as the number of things I can remember that aren't so.
author: Mark Twain

quote: For the sense of smell  almost more than any other  has the power to recall memories and it is a pity that we use it so little.
author: Rachel Carson

quote: I have a remarkable memory  I forget everything. It is wonderfully convenient. It is as though the world were constantly renewing itself for me.
author: Jules Renard

quote: It is commonly seen by experience that excellent memories do often accompany weak judgements.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: There must be at least 500 million rats in the United States  of course  I am speaking only from memory.
author: Edgar Wilson Nye

quote: Nostalgia is a seductive liar.
author: George W. Ball

quote: The past is a work of art  free of irrelevancies and loose ends.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: Oh longing for places that were not Cherished enough in that fleeting hour How I long to make good from afar The forgotten gesture  the additional act.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: 'The horror of that moment ' the King went on  T shall never  never forget!' 'You will  though 'the Queen said  'if you don't make a memorandum of it.'
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: If  after I depart this vale  you ever remember me and have thought to please my ghost  forgive some sinner and wink your eye at some homely girl.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: If a man can remember what he worried about last week  he has a very good memory.
author: Anonymous

quote: That which we remember of our conduct is ignored by our closest neighbour  but that which we have forgotten having said  or even what we never said  will cause laughter even into the next world.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: That which is bitter to endure may be sweet to remember.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: We forget because we must And not because we will.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: Not the power to remember  but its very opposite  the power to forget  is a necessary condition for our existence.
author: Sholem Asch

quote: Memory is the thing you forget with.
author: Alexander Chase

quote: The palest ink is better than the best memory.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good thing for the first time.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Everyone complains of his lack of memory  but nobody of his want of judgement.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Our memories are independent of our wills. It is not so easy to forget.
author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan

quote: Nostalgia isn't what it used to be.
author: Simone Signoret

quote: God gave us memories that we might have roses in December.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: To want to forget something is to think of it.
author: French proverb

quote: What is forgiven is usually well remembered.
author: Louis Dudek

quote: Time whereof the memory of man runneth not to the contrary.
author: Sir William Blackstone

quote: To live in hearts we leave behind  Is not to die.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: Vanity plays lurid tricks with our memory.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Don't you remember sweet Alice Ben Bolt? Sweet Alice  whose hair was so brown  Who wept with delight when you gave her a smile  And trembl'd with fear at your frown!
author: Thomas Dunn

quote: English I remember  I remember  The house where I was born  The little window where the sun Came peeping in at morn  He never came a wink too soon  Nor brought too long a day  But now  I often wish the night Had borne my breath away!
author: Thomas Hood

quote: We must always have old memories and young hopes.
author: Arsene Houssaye

quote: The true art of memory is the art of attention.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: All to myself I think of you  Think of the things we used to do  Think of the things we used to say  Think of each happy bygone day  Sometimes I sigh  and sometimes I smile  But I keep each olden  golden while All to myself.
author: Wilbur D. Nesbit

quote: Women and elephants never forget.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: If I do not remember thee  let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth.
author: Bible

quote: The Right Honorable gentleman is indebted to his memory for his jests and to his imagination for his facts.
author: R. B. Sheridan

quote: A man is never so weak as when a woman is telling him how strong he is.
author: Anonymous

quote: Commuter - One who spends his life in riding to and from his wife  a man who shaves and takes a train  and then rides back to shave again.
author: E. B. White

quote: Eve left Adam  to meet the Devil in private.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: I should like to see any kind of a man  distinguishable from a gorilla that some good and even pretty woman could not shape a husband out of.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged  that a single man in possession of a good fortune  must be in want of a wife.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Manly men and womanly women are still here but feeling nervous.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Men always talk about the most important things to perfect strangers.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Men are made by nature unequal. It is vain  therefore  to treat them as if they were equal.
author: J. A. Froude

quote: That all men are equal is a proposition to which  at ordinary times  no sane individual has ever given his assent.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: There is more difference within the sexes than between them.
author: Ivy Compton-Burnett

quote: When women go wrong  men go right after them.
author: Mae West

quote: Women are never disarmed by compliments. Men always are.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Breathes there a man with hide so tough Who says two sexes aren't enough?
author: Samuel Hoffenstein

quote: If men and women are to understand each other  to enter into each other's nature with mutual sympathy  and to become capable of genuine comradeship  the foundation must be laid in youth.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: American women expect to find in their husbands a perfection that English women only hope to find in their butlers.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: A man's idee in a card game is war- crool  devastatin' and pitiless. A lady's idee iv it is a combynation iv larceny  embezzlement an' burglary.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: Women have one great advantage over men. It is commonly thought that if they marry they have done enough  and need career no further. If a man marries  on the other hand  public opinion is all against him if he takes this view.
author: Rose Macaulay

quote: What is most beautiful in virile men is something feminine  what is most beautiful in feminine women is something masculine.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: In our civilization  men are afraid that they will not be men enough and women are afraid that they might be considered only women.
author: Theodor Reik

quote: A woman means by unselfishness chiefly taking trouble for others  a man means not giving trouble to others. Thus each sex regards the other as basically selfish.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Failing to be there when a man wants her is a woman's greatest sin  except to be there when he doesn't want her.
author: Helen Rowland

quote: There is probably nothing like living together for blinding people to each other.
author: Ivy Compton-Burnett

quote: I wish Adam had died with all his ribs in his body.
author: Dion Boucicault

quote: Behind every great man there is a surprised woman.
author: Maryon Pearson

quote: Behind every successful man you'll find a woman who has nothing to wear.
author: Harold Coffin

quote: If a man hears much that a woman says  she is not beautiful.
author: Henry S. Haskins

quote: God has given you one face  and you make yourselves another.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Men have a much better time of it than women. For one thing  they marry later. For another thing  they die earlier.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: There is no word equivalent to 'cuckold' for women.
author: Joseph Epstein

quote: He and I had an office so tiny that an inch smaller and it would have been adultery.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: A man is a person who will pay two dollars for a one-dollar item he wants. A woman will pay one dollar for a two-dollar item she doesn't want.
author: William Binger

quote: A woman may very well form a friendship with a man  but for this to endure  it must be assisted by a little physical antipathy.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: When I was very young  I kissed my first woman  and smoked my first cigarette on the same day. Believe me  never since have I wasted any more time on tobacco.
author: Arturo Toscanini

quote: The double standard of morality will survive in this world so long as the woman whose husband has been lured away is favoured with the sympathetic tears of other women  and a man whose wife has made off is laughed at by other men.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Flirtation - attention without intention.
author: Max O'Neil

quote: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does. That's his.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: As the faculty of writing has chiefly been a masculine endowment  the reproach of making the world miserable has always been thrown upon the women.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Though statisticians in our time have never kept the score man wants a great deal here below and Woman even more.
author: James Thurber

quote: A good cigar is as great a comfort to a man as a good cry is to a woman.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: A man should be taller  older  heavier  uglier and hoarser than his wife.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Even the wisest men make fools of themselves about women  and even the most foolish women are wise about men.
author: Theodor Reik

quote: I love men  not because they are men  but because they are not women.
author: Christina, Queen of Sweden

quote: It women knew what we were thinking  they'd never stop slapping us.
author: Larry Miller

quote: What's with you men? Would hair stop growing on your chest if you asked directions somewhere?
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: A woman is like a tea bag - only in hot water do you realize how strong she is.
author: Nancy Reagan

quote: Macho does not prove mucho.
author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

quote: Tell me about yourself - your struggles  your dreams  your telephone number.
author: Peter Arno

quote: Be pretty if you can  be witty if you must  be agreeable if it kills you.
author: Elsie de Wolfe

quote: For a single woman  preparing for company means wiping the lipstick off the milk carton.
author: Elayne Boosler

quote: Men like cars  women like clothes. Women only like cars because they take them to clothes.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: She has such a nice sense of rumor.
author: John Cutler

quote: Men don't get cellulite. God might just be a man.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: If you ever leave me  I'll go with you.
author: Rene Taylor

quote: The only time a woman really succeeds in changing a male is when he's a baby.
author: Jacob Braude

quote: What would we say if men changed the length of their trousers every year?
author: Lady Nancy Astor

quote: Boys don't make passes at female smart asses.
author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

quote: Why did God make man before he made woman? Because he didn't want any advice on how to do it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Can you imagine a world without men? No crime and lots of happy fat women.
author: Marion Smith

quote: Man - a creature made at the end of the week's work when God was tired.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Ginger Rogers did everything that Fred Astaire did. She just did it backwards and in high heels.
author: Linda Ellerbee

quote: Men who drink herbal teas are seldom serial killers.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: If the world were a logical place  men would ride sidesaddle.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: Outside every thin girl is a fat man  trying to get in.
author: Anonymous

quote: You know who must be very secure in their masculinity? Male ladybugs.
author: Jay Leno

quote: I want to know why  if men rule the world  they don't stop wearing neckties.
author: Linda Ellerbee

quote: There are more men than women in mental hospitals - which just goes to show who's driving who crazy.
author: Peter Veale

quote: Dennis Thatcher  husband of Margaret Thatcher  when asked who wore the pants in his house  said "I do  and I also wash and iron them." I only like two kinds of men  domestic and foreign.
author: Mae West

quote: It is men who face the biggest problems in the future  adjusting to their new and complicated role.
author: Anna Ford

quote: Macho does not prove mucho.
author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

quote: No man thinks there is much ado about nothing when the ado is about himself.
author: Anthony Trollope

quote: Nothing is so silly as the expression of a man who is being complimented.
author: Andre Gide

quote: The follies which a man regrets most  in his life  are those which he didn't commit when he had the opportunity.
author: Helen Rowland

quote: The male sex still constitute in many ways the most obstinate vested interest one can find.
author: Lord Longford

quote: What is a highbrow? He is a man who has found something more interesting than women.
author: Edgar Wallace

quote: The beauty of stature is the only beauty of men.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Men become old  but they never become good.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Men are what their mothers made them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Men's men: be they gentle or simple  they're much of a muchness.
author: George Eliot

quote: To be a man will continue to demand a heroic heart as long as mankind is not quite human.
author: Julius Fucik

quote: A gentleman does things no gentleman should do in a way only a gentleman can.
author: Luigi Banzini

quote: The right man is the one that seizes the moment.
author: Goethe

quote: Every man in the world is better than someone else  and not as good as someone else.
author: William Saroyan

quote: This is the worst pain a man can suffer: to have insight into much and power over nothing.
author: Herodotus

quote: The world is my country  the human race is my race. The spirit of man is my god  the future of man is my heaven.
author: F. R. Scott

quote: The only things that distinguish us from the rest of the animals  Madam is our habit of drinking when we are not thirsty and making love at any time.
author: Pierre Beaumarchais

quote: There was never any reason to believe in any innate superiority of the male  except his superior muscle.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: I like men to behave like men. I like them strong and childish.
author: Francoise Sagan

quote: Celibacy bestows on a man the qualified freedom of a besieged city where one sometimes has to eat rats.
author: Sean O'Faolain

quote: Men build bridges and throw ra ilroads across deserts  and yet they contend successfully that the job of sewing on a button is beyond them. Accordingly  they don't have to sew buttons.
author: Heywood Broun

quote: As vivacity is the gift of women  gravity is that of men.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: The desire of a man for a woman is not directed at her because she is a human being  but because she is a woman. That she is a human being is of no concern to him.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Two things control man's nature: instinct and experience.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: In his private heart no man much respects himself.
author: Mark Twain

quote: When I was young  I used to have successes with women because I was young. Now I have successes with women because I am old. Middle age was the hardest part.
author: Artur Rubinstein

quote: A man who has been the indisputable favourite of his mother keeps for life the feeling of a conqueror.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: We love women in proportion to their degree of strangeness to us.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: At twenty a man is a peacock  at thirty a lion  at forty a camel  at fifty a serpent  at sixty a dog  at seventy an ape  at eighty  nothing at all.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: Inconsistency is the only thing in which men are consistent.
author: Horatio Smith

quote: There are three classes of men-lovers of wisdom  lovers of honour  lovers of gain.
author: Plato

quote: Among the attributes of God  although they are all equal  mercy shines with even more brilliancy than justice.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: The mercy of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear Him.
author: Bible

quote: Tis mightiest in the mightiest  it becomes The throned monarch better than his crown  His sceptre shows the force of temporal power  The attribute to awe and majesty  Wherein doth sit the dread and fear of kings  But mercy is above this sceptred sway  It is enthroned in the hearts of kings  It is an attribute to God himself  And earthly power doth then show likest God's When mercy seasons justice.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Being all fashioned of the self-same dust. Let us be merciful as well as just.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: A source of innocent merriment! Of innocent merriment.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: Merry have we met  and merry have we been  Merry let us part  and merry meet again  With our merry sing-song  happy gay  and free  With a merry ding-dong  happy let us be!
author: Old English Rhyme

quote: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine.
author: Bible

quote: Let us eat  and be merry.
author: Bible

quote: Nothing is more hopeless than a scheme of merriment.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The dreadful dead of dark midnight.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Once upon a midnight dreary  while I pondered weak and weary  Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: God is Mind  and God is infinite  hence all is Mind.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: The true  strong  and sound mind is the mind that can embrace equally great things and small.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: What is mind? No matter. What is matter? Never mind.
author: T. H. Key

quote: The mind is its own place  and in itself Can make a heaven of hell  a hell of heaven.
author: John Milton

quote: A feeble body weakens the mind.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Tis but a base  ignoble mind That mounts no higher than a bird can soar.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A woman who is found without her veil in some regions of Islam will  it is reported  raise her skirt to cover her face.
author: Raymond Mortimer

quote: 10 persons who speak make more noise than 10 000 who are silent.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: I want to be the white man's brother  not his brother-in-law.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: The nations which have put mankind and posterity most in their debt have been small states - Israel  Athens  Florence  Elizabethan England.
author: Dean William R. Inge

quote: How a minority  Reaching majority  Seizing authority  Hates a minority!
author: Leonard H. Robbins

quote: In the country of the blind  the one-eyed man is king.
author: Erasmus

quote: By gnawing through a dyke  even a rat may drown a nation.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: The thing we have to fear in this country  to my way of thinking  is the influence of the organized minorities  because somehow or other the great majority does not seem to organize. They seem to feel that they are going to be effective because of their own strength  but they give no expression of it.
author: Alfred E. Smith

quote: We must indeed all hang together  or most assuredly we shall all hang separately.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A minority may be right  and a majority is always wrong.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Governments exist to protect the rights of minorities. The loved and the rich need no protection - they have many friends and few enemies.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: It is always the minorities that hold the key of progess  it is always through those who are unafraid to be different that advance comes to human society.
author: Raymond B. Fosdick

quote: A minority group has 'arrived' only when it has the right to produce some fools and scoundrels without the entire group paying for it.
author: Carl T. Rowan

quote: Shall we judge a country by the majority  or by the minority? By the minority  surely.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: One dog barks at something  the rest bark at him.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: The nail that sticks out is hammered down.
author: Japanese proverb

quote: He that is down need fear no fall.
author: John Bunyan

quote: Misery loves company.
author: English proverb

quote: Fire tries gold  misery tries brave men.
author: Seneca

quote: Misery acquaints a man with strange bedfellows.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Misfortunes always come in by a door that has been left open for them.
author: Czech proverb

quote: Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune  but great minds rise above it.
author: Washington Irving

quote: We have all of us sufficient fortitude to bear the misfortunes of others.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Let us be of good cheer  however  remembering that the misfortunes hardest to bear are those which never come.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The worst is not sSo long as we can say "This is the worst."
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A great city is the place to escape the true drama of provincial life  and find solace in fantasy.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: All sins cast long shadows.
author: Irish proverb

quote: Cowardice  as distinguished from panic  is almost always simply a lack of ability to suspend the functioning of the imagination.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Every time history repeats itself  the price goes up.
author: Old saying

quote: The first duty of an historian is to be on his guard against his own sympathies.
author: J. A. Froude

quote: The weak have one weapon: the errors of those who think they are strong.
author: Georges Bidault

quote: Nothing is so simple that it cannot be misunderstood.
author: Freeman Teague

quote: Too much talk will include errors.
author: Burmese proverb

quote: What is the use of running when you are on the wrong road?
author: Old saying

quote: Great services are not canceled by one act or by one single error.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Any man whose errors take ten years to correct  is quite a man.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

quote: There is nothing wrong with making mistakes. Just don't respond with encores.
author: Anonymous

quote: I beseech you  in the bowels of Christ  think it possible you may be mistaken.
author: Oliver Cromwell

quote: Men are men  they needs must err.
author: Euripides

quote: A clever man commits no minor blunders.
author: Goethe

quote: There is no error so monstrous that it fails to find defenders among the ablest men. Imagine a congress of eminent celebrities such as More  Bacon  Grotius  Pascal  Cromwell  Bossuet  Montesquieu  Jefferson  Napoleon  Pitt  etc. The result would be an Encyclopedia of Errors.
author: Lord Acton

quote: Most men would rather be charged with malice than with making a blunder.
author: Josh Billings

quote: It is very easy to forgive others their mistakes. It takes more gut and gumption to forgive them for having witnessed your own.
author: Jessamyn West

quote: Things could be worse. Suppose your errors were counted and published every day  like those of a baseball player.
author: Anonymous

quote: It's over  and can't be helped  and that's one consolation  as they always say in Turkey  when they cut the wrong man's head off.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: A man can believe a considerable deal of rubbish  and yet go about his daily work in a rational and cheerful manner.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: Don't ever take a fence down until you know why it was put up.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The mob is man voluntarily descending to the nature of the beast.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The mob is a sort of bear  while your ring is through its nose  it will even dance under your cudgel  but should the ring slip  and you lose your hold  the brute will turn and rend you.
author: Jane Porter

quote: It has been very truly said that the mob has many heads  but no brains.
author: Antoine de Rivarol

quote: It is best to rise from life as from a banquet  neither thirsty nor drunken.
author: Aristotle

quote: To live long  it is necessary to live slowly.
author: Cicero

quote: A thing moderately good is not so good as it ought to be. Moderation in temper is always a virtue  but moderation in principle is always a vice.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: In everything the middle course is best: all things in excess bring trouble to men.
author: Plautus

quote: Give me neither poverty nor riches.
author: Bible

quote: Modesty is the conscience of the body.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Modesty is the only sure bait when you angle for praise.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Modesty died when false modesty was born.
author: S. L. Clemens

quote: Man is the only animal that blushes. Or needs to.
author: S. L. Clemens

quote: A modest man never talks of himself.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: With people of only moderate ability modesty is mere honesty  but with those who possess great talent it is hypocrisy.
author: Schopenhauer

quote: Be the business never so painful  you may have it done for money.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: But then one is always excited by descriptions of money changing hands. It's much more fundamental than sex.
author: Nigel Dennis

quote: God makes  and apparel shapes: but it's money that finishes the man.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: If a man has money  it is usually a sign too  that he knows how to take care of it  don't imagine his money is easy to get simply because he has plenty of it.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Interest works night and day in fair weather and in foul. It gnaws at a man's substance with invisible teeth.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Inflation is determined by money supply growth.
author: Roger Bootle

quote: Laws go where dollars please.
author: Portuguese proverb

quote: Money can't buy friends  but you can get a better class of enemy.
author: Spike Milligan

quote: Money is not an aphrodisiac: the desire it may kindle in a female eye is more for the cash than the carrier.
author: Marya Marines

quote: Money is the fruit of evil as often as the root of it.
author: Henry Fielding

quote: Money  like a queen  gives rank and beauty .
author: Latin proverb

quote: Riches are for spending.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Some people's money is merited and other people's is inherited.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: There is only one thing for a man to do who is married to a woman who enjoys spending money  and that is to enjoy earning it.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: To be clever enough to get all that money  one must be stupid enough to want it.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Why is there so much month left at the end of the money?
author: Anonymous

quote: Money is the poor people's credit card.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: A man is rich in proportion to the things he can afford to let alone.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Money is like a sixth sense  and you can't make use of the other five without it.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Money swore an oath that nobody who did not love it should ever have it.
author: Irish proverb

quote: I'm so happy to be rich  I'm willing to take all the consequences.
author: Howard Ahmanson

quote: I haven't heard of anybody who wants to stop living on account of the cost.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: It isn't enough for you to love money - it's also necessary that money should love you.
author: Baron Rothschild

quote: Philanthropist: a rich (and usually bald) old gentleman who has trained himself to grin while his conscience is picking his pocket.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: The darkest hour of any man's life is when he sits down to plan how to get money without earning it.
author: Horace Greeley

quote: The petty economies of the rich are just as amazing as the silly extravagances of the poor.
author: William Feather

quote: Money is human happiness in the abstract.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Money is the most egalitarian force in society. It confers power on whoever holds it.
author: Roger Starr

quote: Bankruptcy is a legal proceeding in which you put your money in your pants pocket and give your coat to your creditors.
author: Joey Adams

quote: There are plenty of good five-cent cigars in the country. The trouble is they cost a quarter. What the country really needs is a good five-cent nickle.
author: Franklin P. Adams

quote: I don't like money actually  but it quiets my nerves.
author: Joe Louis

quote: Money isn't everything - but it's a long way ahead of what comes next.
author: Edmund Stockdale

quote: In the bad old days  there were three easy ways of losing money - racing being the quickest  women the pleasantest and farming the most certain.
author: William Pitt Amherst

quote: We forget that money gives its value - that someone exchanged work for it.
author: Neal O'Hara

quote: Money is something you got to make in case you don't die.
author: Max Asnas

quote: If you would know what the Lord God thinks of money  you have only to look at those to whom he gives it.
author: Maurice Baring

quote: Making money is fun  but it's pointless if you don't use the power it brings.
author: John Bentley

quote: Make money and the whole world will conspire to call you a gentleman.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I never been in no situation where havin' money made it any worse.
author: Clinton Jones

quote: Money is the wise man's religion.
author: Euripides

quote: Money  it turned out  was exactly like sex  you thought of nothing else if you didn't have it and thought of other things if you did.
author: James Baldwin

quote: A feast is made for laughter  and wine maketh merry: but money answereth all things.
author: Bible

quote: Neither a borrower nor a lender be for loan oft loses both itself and friend  and borrowing dulls the edge of husbandry.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Never invest your money in anything that eats or needs repairing.
author: Billy Rose

quote: Money is always there but the pockets change  it is not in the same pockets after a change  and that is all there is to say about money.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Men are more often bribed by their loyalties and ambitions than by money.
author: Robert H. Jackson

quote: Money dignifies what is frivolous if unpaid for.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: How do you make a million? You start with $900 000.
author: Stephen Lewis

quote: When you have told anyone you have left him a legacy  the only decent thing to do is to die at once.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: He that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.
author: Bible

quote: Money is good for bribing yourself through the inconveniences of life.
author: Gottfried Reinhardt

quote: There's nothing an economist should fear so much as applause.
author: Herbert Marshall

quote: You can't force anyone to love you or to lend you money.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: With money in your pocket  you are wise  and you are handsome  and you sing well too.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: If the rich could hire other people to die for them  the poor would make a wonderful living.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: The farmer's way of saving money: to be owed by someone he trusted.
author: Hugh MacLennan

quote: Gentlemen prefer bonds.
author: Andrew Mellon

quote: When you want really big money  you usually find yourself talking to people who didn't go to Eton.
author: Anonymous

quote: A good mind possesses a kingdom: a great fortune is a great slavery.
author: Seneca

quote: When it is a question of money  everybody is of the same religion.
author: Voltaire

quote: Money is like muck - not good unless it be spread.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: They make money the old-fashioned way. They inherit it.
author: Brian Morgan

quote: If you like easygoing  monogamous men  stay away from billionaires.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: How to double your money: Fold it over once and put it back in your pocket.
author: Jim Dodds

quote: When asked what he would do if he found a million dollars: "I would try to find the person that lost it  and if he was poor - I'd give it back."
author: Yogi Berra

quote: Money doesn't always bring happiness. People with $10 million are no happier than people with $9 million.
author: Hobart Brown

quote: Right now I have enough money to last me the rest of my life - unless I buy something.
author: Jackie Mason

quote: The rich aren't like us  they pay less taxes.
author: Peter de Vries

quote: A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: He says he's not broke  but he is trying to sell his kidney and corneas.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: There's another advantage in being poor. The doctor will cure you faster.
author: Jacob Braude

quote: We were awfully poor. But we had a lot of things that money can't buy . . . like unpaid bills.
author: Anonymous

quote: "Mommy  we're not going to be poor again  are we?" "Not as long as you have that rare blood type."
author: Brett Butler

quote: It doesn't matter if you're rich or poor  as long as you've got money.
author: Joe E. Lewis

quote: When I was young  I thought money was the most important thing in life. Now that I'm old - I know it is.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I'd like to live like a poor man -  only with lots of money.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: All progress is based upon a universal innate desire on the part of every organism to live beyond its income.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: To make money  buy some good stock  hold it until it goes up  and then sell it. If it doesn't go up  don't buy it.
author: Will Rogers

quote: What some people mistake for the high cost of living is really the cost of living high.
author: Doug Larson

quote: The wretchedness of being rich is that you live with rich people.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Definition of the upper crust: A bunch of crumbs held together by dough.
author: Anonymous

quote: Money can't buy happiness  but it will certainly get you a better class of memories.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: The man who invented slow-motion movies got his idea while watching a Scotsman reach for a check in a restaurant.
author: Anonymous

quote: When asked to borrow money: "I'll see what my lawyer says. . . . And if he says yes  I'll get another lawyer."
author: W. C. Fields

quote: Money won't buy happiness  but it will pay the salaries of a large research staff to study the problem.
author: Bill Vaughan

quote: By the time a man is rich enough to sleep late  he's too old to enjoy it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Money can't buy you happiness  but it does bring you a more pleasant form of misery.
author: Spike Milligan

quote: Another good thing about being poor is that when you are seventy your children will not have you declared legally insane in order to gain control of your estate.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Money makes the man.
author: Aristodemus

quote: A fool and his money are soon parted.
author: George Buchanan

quote: Penny wise  pound foolish.
author: Henry Burton

quote: Wine maketh merry: but money answereth all things.
author: Bible

quote: If you would know the value of money  go and try to borrow some.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Never ask of money spent Where the spender thinks it went. Nobody was ever meant To remember or invent What he did with every cent.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The almighty dollar  that great object of universal devotion throughout our land  seems to have no genuine devotees in these peculiar villages.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Jesus went into the temple... overthrew the tables of the money changers  and the seats of them that sold doves.
author: Bible

quote: When I had money everyone called me brother.
author: Polish proverb

quote: Take care of the pence  and the pounds will take care of themselves.
author: William Lowndes

quote: Ah  take the Cash  and let the Credit go  Nor heed the rumble of a distant Drum!
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: When money speaks the truth is silent.
author: Russian proverb

quote: Money is not required to buy one necessity of the soul.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Not greedy of filthy lucre.
author: Bible

quote: The love of money is the root of all evil.
author: Bible

quote: October turned my maple's leaves to gold  The most are gone now  here and there one lingers  Soon these will slip from out the twig's weak hold  Like coins between a dying miser's fingers.
author: T. B. Aldrich

quote: If cold December gave you birth  The month of snow and ice and mirth  Place on your hand a turquoise blue  Success will bless what'er you do.
author: Anonymous

quote: Thirty days hath September  April  June  and November  All the rest have thirty-one Excepting February alone: Which hath but twenty-eight  in fine  Till leap year gives it twenty-nine.
author: Anonymous

quote: O sweet September  thy first breezes bring The dry leaf's rustle and the squirrel's laughter  The cool fresh air whence health and vigor spring And promise of exceeding joy hereafter.
author: George Arnolds

quote: Oh  to be in England Now that April's there.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: March comes in like a lion and goes out like a lamb.
author: English proverb

quote: If February give much snow A fine Summer it doth foreshow.
author: English proverb

quote: No shade  no shine  no butterflies  no bees  No fruits  no flowers  no leaves  no birds  November!
author: Thomas Hood

quote: And what is so rare as a day in June? Then  if ever  come perfect days  Then Heaven tries earth if it be in tune  And over it softly her warm ear lays.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: As full of spirit as the month of May.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Among the changing months  May stands confest The sweetest  and in fairest colors dressed.
author: James Thomson

quote: Sweet April showers Do bring May flowers.
author: Thomas Tusser

quote: Oh  the lovely fickleness of an April day!
author: W. H. Gibson

quote: The ides of March are come.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: January grey is here  Like a sexton by her grave  February bears the bier  March with grief doth howl and rave  And April weeps - but  O ye hours! Follow with May's fairest flowers.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Those only deserve a monument who do not need one.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Monuments! what are they? the very pyramids have forgotten their builders  or to whom they were dedicated. Deeds  not stones  are the true monuments of the great.
author: John Lothrop Motley

quote: Soldiers  forty centuries are looking down upon you from these pyramids.
author: Napoleon

quote: How like a queen comes forth the lonely Moon From the slow opening curtains of the clouds Walking in beauty to her midnight throne!
author: George Croly

quote: He should  as he list  be able to prove the moon is green cheese.
author: Sir Thomas More

quote: That orbed maiden  with white fire laden  Whom mortals call the moon.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: A truth that's told with bad intent - beats all the lies you can invent.
author: William Blake

quote: An election is a moral horror  as bad as a battle except for the blood  a mud bath for every soul concerned in it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: An improper mind is a perpetual feast.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Every man has his moral backside too  which he doesn't expose unnecessarily but keeps covered as long as possible by the trousers of decorum.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: In statesmanship get formalities right  never mind about the moralities.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It is a public scandal that gives offence and it is no sin to sin in secret.
author: Moliere

quote: Moral indignation is  in most cases  2% moral  48% indignation and 50% envy.
author: Vittorio de Sica

quote: Morality is the theory that every human act must be either right or wrong and that 99% of them are wrong.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Of moral purpose I see no trace in Nature. That is an article of exclusively human manufacture - and very much to our credit.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: One of the misfortunes of our time is that in getting rid of false shame  we have killed off so much real shame as well.
author: Louis Kronenberger

quote: Straight is the gate  and narrow is the way  which leadeth unto life  and few there be that find it.
author: Bible

quote: The flea  though he kill none  he does all the harm he can.
author: John Donne

quote: The only people who should really sin are the people who can sin with a grin.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: The so-called new morality has too often the old immorality condoned.
author: Lord Shawcross

quote: To act without rapacity  to use knowledge with wisdom  to respect interdependence  to operate without hubris and greed are not simply moral imperatives. They are an accurate scientific description of the means of survival.
author: Barbara Ward

quote: If some great power would agree to make me always think what is true and do what is right  on condition of being some sort of clock and wound up every morning before I got out of bed  I should close instantly with the offer.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: We have two kinds of morality side by side: one which we preach but do not practice  and the other which we practice but seldom preach.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: There are ten commandments  right? Well  it's like an exam. You get eight out of ten  you're just about top of the class.
author: Mordecai Richler

quote: A man does not have to be an angel in order to be a saint.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: No man is so exquisitely honest or upright in living but that ten times in his life he might not lawfully be hanged.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: It is often easier to fight for principles than to live up to them.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: Only that which does not teach  which does not cry out  which does not condescend  which does not explain  is irresistible.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Quality - in its classic Greek sense - how to live with grace and intelligence  with bravery and mercy.
author: Theodore H. White

quote: What is morality in any given time or place? It is what the majority then and there happen to like  and immorality is what they dislike.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: No morality can be founded on authority  even if the authority were divine.
author: A. J. Ayer

quote: In any assembly the simplest way to stop transacting business and split the ranks is to appeal to a principle.
author: Jacques Barzun

quote: He who would do good to another must do it in minute particulars: general good is the plea of the scoundrel  hypocrite and flatterer. For art and science cannot exist but in minutely organized particulars.
author: William Blake

quote: You've got to be brave and you've got to be bold. Brave enough to take your chance on your own discrimination - what's right and what's wrong  what's good and what's bad.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Most people sell their souls and live with a good conscience on the proceeds.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: This world is white no longer  and it will never be white again.
author: James Baldwin

quote: Below the navel there is neither religion nor truth.
author: Italian proverb

quote: It is customary these days to ignore what should be done in favour of what pleases us.
author: Plautus

quote: What is morality but immemorial custom? Conscience is the chief of conservatives.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: What you get free costs too much.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: You cannot receive a shock unless you have an electric affinity for that which shocks you.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Even moderation ought not to be practised to excess.
author: Anonymous

quote: When a blind man carries the lame man  both go forward.
author: Swedish proverb

quote: I have found by experience that they who have spent all their lives in cities  improve their talents but impair their virtues  and strengthen their minds but weaken their morals.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Shame and guilt are noble emotions essential in the maintenance of civilized society  and vital for the development of some of the most refined and elegant qualities of human potential - generosity  service  self-sacrifice  unselfishness and duty.
author: Willard Gaylen

quote: If your morals make you dreary  depend on it they are wrong.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Do not be too moral. You may cheat yourself out of much life. So aim above morality. Be not simply good  be good for something.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Moral courage is a more rare commodity than bravery in battle or great intelligence.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quote: Morality is not respectability.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Moral indignation - jealousy with a halo.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Nobody does nothing for nobody for naught.
author: Peter Lord

quote: The man who is anybody and who does anything is surely going to be criticized  vilified  and misunderstood. This is part of the penalty for greatness  and every man understands  too  that it is no proof of greatness.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Morality is a private and costly luxury.
author: Henry Brooks Adams

quote: "Tut  tut  child " said the Duchess. "Everything's got a moral if only you can find it."
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: I never did  or countenanced  in public life  a single act inconsistent with the strictest good faith  having never believed there was one code of morality for a public  and another for a private man.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Dr. Johnson's morality was as English an article as a beefsteak.
author: Alice Hawthorne

quote: To give a man full knowledge of true morality  I would send him to no other book than the New Testament.
author: John Locke

quote: We know no spectacle so ridiculous as the British public in one of its periodical fits of morality.
author: Macaulay

quote: Morality is the best of all devices for leading mankind by the nose.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Do not be too moral. You may cheat yourself out of much life so. Aim above morality. Be not simply good  be good for something.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Now the frosty stars are gone: I have watched them one by one  Fading on the shores of Dawn. Round and full the glorious sun Walks with level step the spray  Through his vestibule of Day.
author: Bayard Taylor

quote: The grey-ey'd morn smiles on the frowning night  Chequering the eastern clouds with streaks of light.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Lose an hour in the morning  and you will be all day hunting for it.
author: Richard Whately

quote: There never was night that had no morn.
author: Dinah Maria Mulock Craik

quote: Weeping may endure for a night  but joy cometh in the morning.
author: Bible

quote: Sadness flies on the wings of the morning  and out of the heart of darkness comes the light.
author: Jean Giraudoux

quote: Out of the scabbard of the night  By God's hand drawn  Flashes his shining sword of light  And lo  the dawn!
author: Frank Dempster Sherman

quote: For what human ill does not dawn seem to be an alleviation?
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: The weariest night  the longest day  sooner or later must perforce come to an end.
author: Baroness Orczy

quote: Beware of desp'rate steps  the darkest day lived till tomorrow will have pass'd away.
author: William Cowper

quote: Have hope. Though clouds environs now  And gladness hides her face in scorn  Put thou the shadow from thy brow- No night but hath its morn.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Snow endures but for a season  and joy comes with the morning.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The morning is wiser than the evening.
author: Russian proverb

quote: For the mind disturbed  the still beauty of dawn is nature's finest balm.
author: Edwin Way Teale

quote: Hold your head high  stick your chest out. You can make it. It gets dark sometimes  but morning comes. ... Keep hope alive.
author: Jesse Jackson

quote: Each day the world is born anew for him who takes it rightly.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: It is a common experience that a problem difficult at night is resolved in the morning after the committee of sleep has worked on it.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Each day is a new life. Seize it. Live it.
author: David Guy Powers

quote: We sail  at sunrise  daily  "outward bound."
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quote: Always begin anew with the day  just as nature does. It is one of the sensible things that nature does.
author: George E. Woodberry

quote: With each sunrise  we start anew.
author: Anonymous

quote: I have always been delighted at the prospect of a new day  a fresh try  one more start  with perhaps a bit of magic waiting somewhere behind the morning.
author: J. B. Priestly

quote: Relying on God has to begin all over again every day as if nothing had yet been done.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Have patience with all things  but chiefly have patience with yourself. Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections  but instantly set about remedying them-every day begin the task anew.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: Each day is a little life  every waking and rising a little birth  every fresh morning a little youth  every going to rest and sleep a little death.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: I love the challenge of starting at zero every day and seeing how much I can accomplish.
author: Martha Stewart

quote: Whether one is twenty  forty  or sixty  whether one has succeeded  failed or just muddled along  whether yesterday was full of sun or storm  or one of those dull days with no weather at all  life begins each morning! ... Each morning is the open door to a new world-new vistas  new aims  new tryings.
author: Leigh Mitchell Hodges

quote: To be seeing the world made new every morning  as if it were the morning of the first day  and then to make the most of it for the individual soul as if each were the last day  is the daily curriculum of the mind's desire.
author: John H. Finley

quote: Do not say  "It is morning " and dismiss it with a name of yesterday. See it for the first time as a newborn child that has no name.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: God had infinite time to give us.... He cut it up into a near succession of new mornings  and  with each  therefore  a new idea  new inventions  and new applications.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: We are new every day.
author: Irene Claremont de Castillego

quote: No matter how big or soft or warm your bed is  you still have to get out of it.
author: Grace Slick

quote: Spill not the morning (the quintessence of the day!) in recreations  for sleep is a recreation. Add not  therefore  sauce to sauce. ... Pastime  like wine  is poison in the morning. It is then good husbandry to sow the head  which hath lain fallow all night  with some serious work.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Do not shorten the morning by getting up late  look upon it as the quintessence of life  and to a certain extent sacred.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Let us then be up and doing  with a heart for any fate.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: He'd jolt up in bed every morning  sit quietly for a moment  and you could feel those wheels spinning in his mind as he planned his day. Then he'd hit the floor almost on the run.
author: Sasha Stallone

quote: Clay lies still  but blood's a rover Breath's a ware that will not keep. Up lad: when the journey's over There'll be time enough to sleep.
author: A. E. Housman

quote: Even if a farmer intends to loaf  he gets up in time to get an early start.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Wake at dawn with a winged heart and give thanks for another day of loving.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: I thank You God for this most amazing day  for the leaping greenly spirits of trees and a blue true dream of sky  and for everything which is natural which is infinite which is yes.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: I get up and I bless the light thin clouds and the first twittering of birds  and the breathing air and smiling face of the hills.
author: Giacomo Leopardi

quote: I'm a most lucky and thankful woman. Lucky and thankful for each morning I wake up. For three wonderful daughters and one son. For an understanding and very loving husband with whom I've shared fifty-two blessed years  all in good health.
author: Thelma Elliott

quote: If God adds another day to our life  let us receive it gladly.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Here we stand between two eternities of darkness. What are we to do with this glory while it is still ours?
author: Gilbert Murray

quote: Your morning thoughts may determine your conduct for the day. Optimistic thoughts will make your day bright and productive  while pessimistic thinking will make it dull and wasteful. Face each day cheerfully  smilingly and courageously  and it will naturally follow that your work will be a real pleasure and progress will be a delightful accomplishment.
author: William M. Peck

quote: You should always know when you're shifting gears in life. You should leave your era  it should never leave you.
author: Leontyne Price

quote: The first thing each morning  and the last thing each night  suggest to yourself specific ideas that you wish to embody in your character and personality. Address such suggestions to yourself  silently or aloud  until they are deeply impressed upon your mind.
author: Grenville Kleiser

quote: Everyday ask yourself the question  "Do I want to experience Peace of Mind or do I want to experience Conflict ?"
author: Gerald Jampolsky

quote: It was only a sunny smile  And little it cost in the giving. But like morning light  it scattered the night  And made the day worth living.
author: Anonymous

quote: To get up each morning with the resolve to be happy ... is to set our own conditions to the events of each day. To do this is to condition circumstances instead of being conditioned by them.
author: Ralph Waldo Trine

quote: Today is a new day. You will get out of it just what you put into it. ... If you have made mistakes  even serious mistakes  there is always another chance for you. And supposing you have tried and failed again and again  you may have a fresh start any moment you choose  for this thing that we call "failure" is not the falling down  but the staying down.
author: Mary Pickford

quote: When you rise in the morning  form a resolution to make the day a happy one for a fellow creature.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: As soon as you open your eyes in the morning  you can square away for a happy and successful day. It's the mood and the purpose at the inception of each day that are the important facts in charting your course for the day. We can always square away for a fresh start  no matter what the past has been.
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: This is the beginning of a new day. God has given me this day to use as I will. I can waste it or use it for good  but what I do today is important  because I am exchanging a day of my life for it! When tomorrow comes  this day will be gone forever  leaving in its place something that I have traded for it. I want it to be gain  and not loss  good  and not evil  success  and not failure  in order that I shall not regret the price I have paid for it.
author: Anonymous

quote: I think in terms of the day's resolutions  not the year's.
author: Henry Moore

quote: Every new day begins with possibilities. It's up to us to fill it with the things that move us toward progress and peace.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: Here hath been dawning another blue day: think  wilt thou let it slip useless away?
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Be pleasant until ten o'clock in the morning and the rest of the day will take care of itself.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Today a thousand doors of enterprise are open to you  inviting you to useful work. To live at this time is an inestimable privilege  and a sacred obligation devolves upon you to make right use of your opportunities. Today is the day in which to attempt and achieve something worthwhile.
author: Grenville Kleiser

quote: Get out of bed forcing a smile. You may not smile because you are cheerful  but if you will force yourself to smile you'll... be cheerful because you smile. Repeated experiments prove that when man assumes the facial expression of a given mental mood  any given mood  then that mental mood itself will follow.
author: Kenneth Goode

quote: He who every morning plans the transactions of the day and follows that plan carries thread that will guide him through the labyrinth of the most busy life.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A man without a plan for the day is lost before he starts.
author: Lewis K. Bendele

quote: Never be afraid to sit awhile and think.
author: Lorraine Hansbury

quote: Only the thinking man lives his life  the thoughtless man's life passes him by.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: My credo is etched on my mirror in my bathroom and I see it when I brush my teeth in the morning. It says  "Don't worry  Be Happy  Feel Good." When you see that first thing  and you reflect on it  the rest of the day seems to glide by pretty well.
author: Larry Hagman

quote: Only that day dawns to which we are awake.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The day returns and brings us the petty round of irritating concerns and duties. Help us to play the man  help us to perform them with laughter and kind faces  let cheerfulness abound with industry. Give us to go blithely on our business all this day  bring us to our resting beds weary and content and undishonored  and grant us in the end the gift of sleep.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: A day dawns  quite like other days  in it  a single hour comes  quite like other hours  but in that day and in that hour the chance of a lifetime faces us.
author: Maltbie D. Babcock

quote: One never knows what each day is going to bring. The important thing is to be open and ready for it.
author: Henry Moore

quote: Great opportunities come to all  but many do not know they have met them. The only preparation to take advantage of them is ... to watch what each day brings.
author: Albert E. Dunning

quote: There will be something  anguish or elation  that is peculiar to this day alone. I rise from sleep and say: Hail to the morning! Come down to me  my beautiful unknown.
author: Jessica Powers

quote: The sun is new each day.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Someday the sun is going to shine down on me in some faraway place.
author: Mahalia Jackson

quote: With every rising of the sun  think of your life as just begun.
author: Anonymous

quote: I feel very happy to see the sun come up every day. I feel happy to be around. ... I like to take this day- any day-and go to town with it.
author: James Dickey

quote: Look to the East  where up the lucid sky The morning climbs! The day shall yet be fair.
author: Celia Thaxter

quote: Each golden sunrise ushers in new opportunities for those who retain faith in themselves  and keep their chins up.... Meet the sunrise with confidence. Fill every golden minute with right thinking and worthwhile endeavor. Do this and there will be joy for you in each golden sunset.
author: Alonzo Newton Benn

quote: Today a new sun rises for me  everything lives  everything is animated  everything seems to speak to me of my passion  everything invites me to cherish it.
author: Anne De Lenclos

quote: What humbugs we are  who pretend to live for Beauty  and never see the Dawn!
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Sunrise: day's great progenitor.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Put yourself in competition with yourself each day. Each morning look back upon your work of yesterday and then try to beat it.
author: Charles M. Sheldon

quote: The morning has gold in its mouth.
author: German proverb

quote: Do you know what the greatest test is? Do you still get excited about what you do when you get up in the morning?
author: David Halberstam

quote: Oft when the white  still dawn lifted the skies and pushed the hills apart  I have felt it like a glory in my heart.
author: Edwin Markham

quote: Sometimes I have believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: The mind is found most acute and most uneasy in the morning. Uneasiness is  indeed  a species of sagacity-a passive sagacity. Fools are never uneasy.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Day's sweetest moments are at dawn.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: All flesh shall perish together  and man shall turn again unto dust.
author: Bible

quote: Oh  why should the spirit of mortal be proud? Like a fast-flitting meteor  a fast-flying cloud  A flash of the lightning  a break of the wave  He passes from life to his rest in the grave.
author: William Knox

quote: The mother of all living.
author: Bible

quote: She's somebody's mother  boys  you know  For all she's aged and poor and slow.
author: Mary Dow Brine

quote: A mother is a mother still  The holiest thing alive.
author: Hartley Coleridge

quote: Men are what their mothers made them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: What is home without a mother?
author: Alice Hawthorne

quote: There is none  In all this cold and hollow world  no fount Of deep strong  deathless love  save that within A mother's heart.
author: Felicia D. Hemans

quote: If I were hanged on the highest hill  Mother o' mine  O mother o' mine! I know whose love would follow me still  Mother o' mine  O mother o' mine!
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: All that I am or hope to be  I owe to my angel mother.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: I arose a mother in Israel.
author: Bible

quote: The bravest battle that ever was fought  Shall I tell you where and when? On the maps of the world you will find it not  It was fought by the mothers of men.
author: Joaquin Miller

quote: Who ran to help me when I fell  And would some pretty story tell  Or kiss the place to make it well? My Mother.
author: Anne Taylor

quote: For the hand that rocks the cradle Is the hand that rules the world.
author: William Ross Wallace

quote: Sure I love the dear silver that shines in your hair  And the brow that's all furrowed  and wrinkled with care. I kiss the dear fingers  so toil-worn for me  Oh  God bless you and keep you  Mother Machree.
author: Rida Johnson Young

quote: Her children arise up and call her blessed.
author: Bible

quote: Fatherhood is pretending the present you love most is soap-on-a-rope.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Definition of Father's Day: Same as Mother's Day but you don't spend as much.
author: Anonymous

quote: My folks refused to have more than four children after reading that every fifth child born in the world is Chinese.
author: Anonymous

quote: No matter what  Dad was always there with solid words of advice . . . "Go ask your mother."
author: Alan Ray

quote: Father reading report card: One thing in your favor -  with these grades  you couldn't possibly be cheating.
author: Jacob Braude

quote: Every small boy wonders why his father didn't go into the ice cream business.
author: Anonymous

quote: No matter how old a mother is  she still watches her middle-aged children for signs of improvement.
author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

quote: There are three books my daughter felt were the most important influences in her life: the Bible  her mother's cookbook  and her father's checkbook.
author: Joyce Mattingly

quote: Grandchildren don't make a man feel old  it's the knowledge that he's married to a grandmother.
author: G. Norman Collie

quote: Dad named his first ulcer after me.
author: Anonymous

quote: It is a wise child that knows its own father  and an unusual one that unreservedly approves of him.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Before I got married I had six theories about bringing up children  now I have six children and no theories.
author: John Wilmot

quote: When I was a boy of fourteen  my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be twenty-one  I was astonished at how much he had learned in seven years.
author: Mark Twain

quote: My mother phones daily to ask  "Did you just try to reach me?" When I reply no  she adds  "So  if you're not too busy  call me while I'm still alive " . . . and hangs up.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: Most men are secretly still mad at their mothers for throwing away their comic books. They would be valuable now.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: There's no such thing as a nonworking mother.
author: Hester Mundis

quote: God could not be everywhere  and therefore he made mothers.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: MOTHER TO TEENAGER ON SUNDAY MORNING: I believe I heard the clock strike one when you came in last night. teen: Well  I know how much you need your sleep  so it was going to strike ten but I stopped it at one chime.
author: Anonymous

quote: I hope I look as good as my mother does when I reach the age she says she isn't.
author: Anonymous

quote: I found out why cats drink out of the toilet. My mother told me it's because it's cold in there. And I'm like: How did my mother know that?
author: Wendy Liebman

quote: The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found.
author: Calvin Trillin

quote: What makes life dreary is want of motive.
author: George Eliot

quote: They never die  who have the future in them.
author: Meridel Le Sueur

quote: As long as I have a want  I have a reason for living. Satisfaction is death.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: One must not lose desires. They are mighty stimulants to creativeness  to love and to long life.
author: Alexander A. Bogomoletz

quote: Take away the cause  and the effect ceases.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Every true man  sir  who is a little above the level of the beasts and plants  lives so as to give a meaning and a value to his own life.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: The secret of discipline is motivation. When a man is sufficiently motivated  discipline will take care of itself.
author: Sir Alexander Paterson

quote: Where the willingness is great  the difficulties cannot be great.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Talent isn't enough. You need motivation-and persistence  too: what Steinbeck called a blend of faith and arrogance.
