quote: Since a politician never believes what he says  he is surprised when others believe him.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: Power is a drug on which the politicians are hooked. They buy it from the voters  using the voters' own money.
author: Richard J. Needham

quote: a politician is an arse upon which everyone has sat except a man.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: A ginooine statesman should be on his guard  if he must hev beliefs  not to b'lieve 'em too hard.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: More men have been elected between Sundown and Sunup than ever were elected between Sunup and Sundown.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Macdonald's Law: Never write a letter if you can help it  and never destroy one.
author: John A. Macdonald

quote: He is a pragmatist. He is not right wing  nor left wing  nor any wing.
author: Robert Stanfield

quote: Politicians make good company for a while just as children do - their self-enjoyment is contagious. But they soon exhaust their favourite subjects -themselves.
author: Garry Wills

quote: Your representative owes you  not his industry only  but his judgement  and he betrays instead of serving you if he sacrifices it to your opinion.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: The most important office is that of private citizen.
author: Louis D. Brandeis

quote: I'm not an old  experienced hand at politics. But I am now seasoned enough to have learned that the hardest thing about any political campaign is how to win without proving that you are unworthy of winning.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: Never retract  never explain  never apologize - get the thing done and let them howl.
author: Nellie McClung

quote: A Conservative is a man who will not look at the new moon  out of respect for that ancient institution  the old one.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: All I know is I'm not a Marxist.
author: Karl Marx

quote: The fact that a reactionary can sometimes be right is a little less recognized that the fact that a liberal can be. . . .
author: Joseph Gies

quote: An independent is a guy who wants to take the politics out of politics.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: Any woman who understands the problems of running a home will be nearer to understanding the problems of running a country.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: I just received the following wire from my generous Daddy "Dear Jack: Don't buy a single vote more than necessary. I'll be damned if I am going to pay for a landslide."
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: If we cannot now end our differences  at least we can help make the world safe for diversity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: In politics it is necessary either to betray one's country or the electorate. I prefer to betray the electorate.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: Nobody is qualified to become a statesman who is entirely ignorant of the problems of wheat.
author: Socrates

quote: Politics is a blood sport.
author: Aneurin Bevan

quote: Politics is supposed to be the second oldest profession. I have come to realize that it bears a very close resemblance to the first.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: Politics is the diversion of trivial men who  when they succeed at it  become important in the eyes of more trivial men.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: The great nations have always acted like gangsters  and the small nations like prostitutes.
author: Stanley Kubrick

quote: The heaviest penalty for deciding to engage in politics is to be ruled by someone inferior to yourself.
author: Plato

quote: The Labour Party is going about the country stirring up apathy.
author: William White law

quote: The radical invents the views. When he has worn them out  the conservative adopts them.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The trouble with socialists is that they let their bleeding hearts go to their bloody heads.
author: Tommy Douglas

quote: The world is a dangerous place to live - not because of the people who are evil but because of the people who don't do anything about it.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: There cannot be a crisis next week. My schedule is already full.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: Three people marooned on a desert island would soon reinvent politics.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: We're eyeball to eyeball  and I think the other fellow just blinked.
author: Dean Rusk

quote: What matters in Politics is what men actually do - sincerity is no excuse for acting unpolitically  and insincerity may be channelled by politics into good results.
author: Bernard Crick

quote: When Cicero (Marcus Tullius Cicero 106-43 BC ) was in 64 BC running for consul of Rome he was reported to be advised by his "campaign manager" that the voters "had rather you lied to them than refused them."
author: Anonymous

quote: The essential ingredient of politics is timing.
author: Pierre Elliott Trudeau

quote: It was a storm in a tea cup  but in politics we sail in paper boats.
author: Harold Macmillan

quote: Party-spirit . . . which at best is but the madness of many for the gain of a few.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Practical politics consists in ignoring facts.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Ultimately politics in a democracy reflects values much more than it shapes them.
author: Arnold A. Rogow

quote: Politics is not a good location or a vocation for anyone lazy  thin-skinned or lacking a sense of humour.
author: John Bailey

quote: A question which can be answered without prejudice to the government is not a fit question to ask.
author: John G. Diefenbaker

quote: I have never found  in a long experience of politics  that criticism is ever inhibited by ignorance.
author: Harold Macmillan

quote: Politics  as a practice  whatever its professions  has always been the systematic organization of hatreds.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Politics  and the fate of mankind  are shaped by men without ideals and without greatness.
author: Albert Camus

quote: If you ever injected truth into politics you would have no politics.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The sad duty of politics is to establish justice in a sinful world.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: There is no worse heresy than that the office sanctifies the holder of it.
author: Lord Acton

quote: Poetry was the maiden I loved  but politics was the harridan I married.
author: Joseph Howe

quote: Damn your principles! Stick to your party!
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Politics is a field where action is one long second best and where the choice constantly lies between two blunders.
author: John Morley

quote: Politics is the science of how who gets what  when and why.
author: Sidney Hillman

quote: Politics is but the common pulse beat.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: Politics is the gizzard of society  full of gut and gravel.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: In politics a week is a very long time.
author: Harold Wilson

quote: The more you read about politics  the more you got to admit that each party is worse than the other.
author: Will Rogers

quote: In academic life you seek to state absolute truths  in politics you seek to accommodate truth to the facts around you.
author: Pierre Elliott Trudeau

quote: Politics. The diplomatic name for the law of the jungle.
author: Ely Culbertson

quote: There is a certain satisfaction in coming down to the lowest ground of politics  for then we get rid of cant and hypocrisy.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: In politics a community of hatred is almost always the foundation of friendships.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: Politics has got so expensive that it takes lots of money to even get beat with.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Honest statesmanship is the wise employment of individual meannesses for the public good.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Politics is war without bloodshed  and war is politics with blood.
author: Mao Tse-Tung

quote: This proves what a purifying effect women would have on politics.
author: Nellie McClung

quote: Congress is so strange. A man gets up to speak and says nothing. Nobody listens  then everybody disagrees.
author: Boris Marshalov

quote: This organization (United Nations) is created to prevent you from going to hell. It isn't created to take you to heaven.
author: Henry Cabot Lodge

quote: Nothing was ever done so systematically as nothing is being done now.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: It will not be any European statesman who will unite Europe: Europe will be united by the Chinese.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: There is no excitement anywhere in the world  short of war  to match the excitement of the American presidential campaign.
author: Theodore White

quote: A dictatorship is a country where they have taken the politics out of politics.
author: Sam Himmel

quote: Vote for the man who promises least  he'll be the least disappointing.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: What counts is not necessarily the size of the dog in the fight - it's the size of the fight in the dog.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Someone asked me... how I felt and I was reminded of a story that a fellow townsman of ours used to tell - Abraham Lincoln. They asked him how he felt once after an unsuccessful election. He said he felt like a little boy who has stubbed his toe in the dark. He said that he was too old to cry  but it hurt too much to laugh.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: Democracy is good. I say this because other systems are worse.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: There are two problems in my life. The political ones are insoluble and the economic ones are incomprehensible.
author: Alexander Douglas-Home

quote: The lady's not for turning.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: I have never regarded politics as the arena of morals. It is the arena of interests.
author: Aneurin Bevan

quote: In politics  a straight line is the shortest distance to disaster.
author: John P. Roche

quote: In order to become the master  the politician poses as the servant.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: You know very well that whether you are on page one or page thirty depends on whether they fear you. It is just as simple as that.
author: Richard Nixon

quote: If people have to choose between freedom and sandwiches they will take sandwiches.
author: Lord Boyd-Orr

quote: Once upon a time my political opponents honored me as possessing the fabulous intellectual and economic power by which I created a worldwide depression all by mself.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: In our age there is no such thing as 'keeping out of polities'. All issues are political issues.
author: George Orwell

quote: Deep down he is shallow.
author: Political saying

quote: As I learnt very early in my life in Whitehall  the acid test of any political question is: What is the alternative?
author: Lord Trent

quote: Dirksen's Three Laws of Politics: 1. Get elected. 2. Get re-elected. 3. Don't get mad  get even.
author: Everett Dirksen

quote: Forgiving is all  forgetting is another thing.
author: Bob Rae

quote: He's like a football coach who's smart enough to win the game  and dumb enough to think it's important.
author: Eugene McCarthy

quote: The Senate is the last primitive society in the world. We still worship the elders of the tribe and honour the territorial imperative.
author: Eugene McCarthy

quote: To the victor belong the spoils of the enemy.
author: William L. Marcy

quote: I pledge you  I pledge myself  to a new deal for the American people. Let us all here assembled constitute ourselves prophets of a new order of competence and courage. This is a call to arms.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: A statesman is an easy man  He tells his lies by rote  A journalist makes up his lies And takes you by the throat  So stay at home and drink your beer And let the neighbours vote.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Politics is more dangerous than war  for in war you are only killed once.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Money is the mother's milk of politics.
author: Jesse Unruh

quote: One fifth of the people are against everything all the time.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quote: Those who make peaceful revolution impossible will make violent revolution inevitable.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Being in politics is like being a football coach. You have to be smart enough to understand the game  and dumb enough to think it's important.
author: Eugene McCarthy

quote: Did you ever see that painting the Mona Lisa. It always reminds me of a reporter listening to a politician.
author: Robert Orben

quote: A politician is a fellow who will lay down your life for his country.
author: Texas Guinan

quote: It's nice to have four years between elections. It takes people that long to regain their faith.
author: Anonymous

quote: Men in high levels of government seldom surf.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: Liberals think you can reform an ax murderer. They don't want to kill anything. They want to change the Listerine labels to "Rehabilitate the germs that cause bad breath."
author: Marc Price

quote: A politician is a person who can make waves and then make you think he's the only one who can save the ship.
author: Ivern Ball

quote: A conservative is a Democrat who's been mugged. I think we should just tip the government if it does a good job. Fifteen percent is the standard tip  isn't it?
author: Vat Paulsen

quote: I'm proud to be paying taxes in the United States. The only thing is - I could be just as proud for half the money.
author: Arthur Godfrey

quote: I have the perfect simplified tax form for government. Why don't they just print our money with a return address on it?
author: Bob Hope

quote: Vice president: A spare tire on the automobile of government.
author: John Nance Garner

quote: Harold Wilson is going around the country stirring up apathy.
author: William Whitelaw

quote: The prerequisites for being in the diplomatic corps are the ability to handle protocol  alcohol  and Geritol.
author: Wallace Rowling

quote: As a politician he does everything to keep out of trouble  often by not asking questions. However  it does bother him that every time the doorbell rings his maid hides in the dryer.
author: Jay Leno

quote: Instead of giving a politician the keys to the city  it might be better to change the locks.
author: Doug Larson

quote: He is so aware of being politically correct he refers to a taco as Hispanic food.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: I don't pick on politicians. They ain't done nothin'.
author: Red Skelton

quote: When I was a boy  I was told that anybody could become president. I'm beginning to believe it.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: Elections in L.A. are so different. Here you've got politicians with phony smiles making false promises to voters with fake boobs and bad toupees.
author: Jay Leno

quote: Unlike Churchill  I have no plans to shape history. . . . Socrates gave advice - and they poisoned him.
author: George Bush

quote: What obstructs the vision and is called smog in our big cities is called defining the issues in politics
author: Anonymous

quote: Standing in the middle of the road is very dangerous  you get knocked down by the traffic from both sides.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: The public is very fickle  as I was saying to my cabdriver  Gerald Ford.
author: Pat McCormick

quote: It is dangerous for a national candidate to say things that people might remember.
author: Eugene McCarthy

quote: They pick a president  and then for four years they pick on him.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: A politican is an animal who can sit on a fence and yet keep both ears to the ground.
author: Anonymous

quote: All political parties die at last of swallowing their own lies.
author: John Arbuthnot

quote: Man is by nature a civic animal.
author: Aristotle

quote: Politics is not an exact science.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: A politician thinks of the next election  a statesman  of the next generation.
author: James Freeman Clarke

quote: It is a condition which confronts us - not a theory.
author: Grover Cleveland

quote: A majority is always better than the best repartee.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Damned Neuters  in their Middle way of Steering  Are neither Fish  nor Flesh  nor good Red Herring.
author: John Dryden

quote: I always voted at my party's call  And I never thought of thinking for myself at all.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: The purification of politics is an iridescent dream.
author: John Ingalls

quote: Like an armed warrior  like a plumed knight  James G. Blaine marched down the halls of American Congress and threw his shining lance full and fair against the brazen foreheads of the defamers of his country  and the malign-ers of his honor.
author: Charles J. Ingersoll

quote: If a due participation of office is a matter of right  how are vacancies to be obtained? Those by death are few  by resignation  none.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Nothing is politically right which is morally wrong.
author: Daniel O'Connell

quote: Politics is but the common pulsebeat  of which revolution is the feverspasm.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: The Republicans have their splits right after election and Democrats have theirs just before an election.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The statesman shears the sheep  the politician skins them.
author: Austin O'Malley

quote: My hat's in the ring. The fight is one and I'm stripped to the buff.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Something is rotten in the state of Denmark.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: If nominated I will not accept  if elected I will not serve.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: Who is the dark horse he has in his stable?
author: William Thackeray

quote: As long as I count the votes what are you going to do about it?
author: William M. Tweed

quote: Popular applause veers with the wind.
author: John Bright

quote: The actor's popularity is evanescent  applauded today  forgotten tomorrow.
author: Edwin Forrest

quote: Beauty to me is being comfortable in your own skin.
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

quote: Man is what he believes.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Believe that life is worth living  and your belief will help create that fact.
author: William James

quote: Dream lofty dreams  and as you dream  so shall you become. Your vision is the promise of what you shall at last unveil.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Our belief at the beginning of a doubtful undertaking is the one thing that ensures the successful outcome of our venture.
author: William James

quote: We are what we believe we are.
author: Benjamin N. Cardozo

quote: If you constantly think of illness  you eventually become ill  if you believe yourself to be beautiful  you become so.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: You have to believe in happiness  or happiness never comes.
author: Douglas Malloch

quote: If you keep on saying things are going to be bad  you have a good chance of being a prophet.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: What one believes to be true either is true or becomes true within limits to be found experientially and experimentally. These limits are beliefs to be transcended.
author: John Lilly

quote: The thing always happens that you really believe in  and the belief in a thing makes it happen.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: The name we give to something shapes our attitude toward it.
author: Katherine Paterson

quote: This I know. This I believe with all my heart. If we want a free and peaceful world  if we want to make the deserts bloom and man grow to greater dignity as a human being- we can do it!
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The name we give to something shapes our attitude toward it.
author: Katherine Paterson

quote: This I know. This I believe with all my heart. If we want a free and peaceful world  if we want to make the deserts bloom and man grow to greater dignity as a human being-we can do it!
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Failure is impossible.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: If you think you can  you can. And if you think you can't  you're right.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: When you look at the world in a narrow way  how narrow it seems! When you look at it in a mean way  how mean it is! When you look at it selfishly  how selfish it is! But when you look at it in a broad  generous  friendly spirit  what wonderful people you find in it.
author: Horace Rutledge

quote: Always keep that happy attitude. Pretend that you are holding a beautiful fragrant bouquet.
author: Candice M. Pope

quote: She was one of those happily created beings who please without effort  make friends everywhere  and take life so gracefully and easily that less fortunate souls are tempted to believe that such are born under a lucky star.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: It was completely fruitless to quarrel with the world  whereas the quarrel with oneself was occasionally fruitful and always  she had to admit  interesting.
author: May Sarton

quote: Each of us makes his own weather  determines the color of the skies in the emotional universe which he inhabits.
author: Fulton J. Sheen

quote: One of the things I learned the hard way was that it doesn't pay to get discouraged. Keeping busy and making optimism a way of life can restore your faith in yourself.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: Life is raw material. We are artisans. We can sculpt our existence into something beautiful  or debase it into ugliness. It's in our hands.
author: Cathy Better

quote: I invented my life by taking for granted that everything I did not like would have an opposite  which I would like.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: If you look at life one way  there is always cause for alarm.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: Being tall is an advantage  especially in business. People will always remember you. And if you're in a crowd  you'll always have some clean air to breathe.
author: Julia Child

quote: It is only in sorrow bad weather masters us  in joy we face the storm and defy it.
author: Amelia Barr

quote: The pure  the beautiful  the bright  That stirred our hearts in youth  The impulse to a wordless prayer  The dreams of love and truth  The longings after something lost  The spirit's yearning cry  The strivings after better hopes  These things can never die.
author: Sarah Doudney

quote: I actually remember feeling delight  at two o'clock in the morning  when the baby woke for his feed  because I so longed to have another look at him.
author: Margaret Drabble

quote: Teenagers travel in droves  packs  swarms. ... To the librarian  they're a gaggle of geese. To the cook  they're a scourge of locusts. To department stores  they're a big beautiful exaltation of larks ... all lovely and loose and jingly.
author: Bernice Fitz-Gibbon

quote: Both abundance and lack exist simultaneously in our lives  as parallel realities. It is always our conscious choice which secret garden we will tend ... when we choose not to focus on what is missing from our lives but are grateful for the abundance that's present-love  health  family  friends  work  the joys of nature  and personal pursuits that bring us pleasure-the wasteland of illusion falls away and we experience heaven on earth.
author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

quote: Exude happiness and you will feel it back a thousand times.
author: Joan Lunden

quote: I keep my ideals  because in spite of everything I still believe that people are really good at heart.
author: Anne Frank

quote: Man's rise or fall  success or failure  happiness or unhappiness depends on his attitude ... a man's attitude will create the situation he imagines.
author: James Lane Allen

quote: A good heart will help you to a bonny face  my lad ... and a bad one will turn the bonniest into something worse than ugly.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: The greatest discovery of my generation is that man can alter his life simply by altering his attitude of mind.
author: William James

quote: I think there is a choice possible to us at any moment  as long as we live. But there is no sacrifice. There is a choice  and the rest falls away. Second choice does not exist. Beware of those who talk about sacrifice.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: Life has  indeed  many ills  but the mind that views every object in its most cheering aspect  and every doubtful dispensation as replete with latent good  bears within itself a powerful and perpetual antidote.
author: Lydia H. Sigourney

quote: Immense power is acquired by assuring yourself in your secret reveries that you were born to control affairs.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: A woman's hopes are woven of sunbeams  a shadow annihilates them.
author: George Eliot

quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadow.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Man's real life is happy  chiefly because he is ever expecting that it soon will be so.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Some folks never exaggerate-they just remember big.
author: Audrey Snead

quote: I expect some new phases of life this summer  and shall try to get the honey from each moment.
author: Lucy Stone

quote: Love is much nicer to be in than an automobile accident  a tight girdle  a higher tax bracket  or a holding pattern over Philadelphia.
author: Judith Viorst

quote: I am optimistic and confident in all that I do. I affirm only the best for myself and others. I am the creator of my life and my world. I meet daily challenges gracefully and with complete confidence. I fill my mind with positive  nurturing  and healing thoughts.
author: Alice Potter

quote: 'Tis very certain the desire of life prolongs it.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Happiness is the ability to recognize it.
author: Carolyn Wells

quote: The saddest day hath gleams of light  The darkest wave hath bright foam beneath it  The twinkles o'er the cloudiest night  Some solitary star to cheer it.
author: Sarah Winnemucca

quote: Every thought we think is creating our future.
author: Louise L. Hay

quote: Could we change our attitude  we should not only see life differently  but life itself would come to be different. Life would undergo a change of appearance because we ourselves had undergone a change in attitude.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: The words "I am ..." are potent words  be careful what you hitch them to. The thing you're claiming has a way of reaching back and claiming you.
author: A. L. Kitselman

quote: Self-image sets the boundaries of individual accomplishment.
author: Maxwell Maltz

quote: We are not interested in the possibilities of defeat.
author: Victoria, Queen of England

quote: To think of losing is to lose already.
author: Sylvia Townsend Warner

quote: Nothing can stop the man with the right mental attitude from achieving his goal  nothing on earth can help the man with the wrong mental attitude.
author: WW. Ziege

quote: If you expect nothing  you're apt to be surprised. You'll get it.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: Life is like a mirror. Smile at it and it smiles back at you.
author: Peace Pilgrim

quote: Since the human body tends to move in the direction of its expectations-plus or minus-it is important to know that attitudes of confidence and determination are no less a part of the treatment program than medical science and technology.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: They can because they think they can.
author: Virgil

quote: I do think that being the second [female Supreme Court Justice] is wonderful  because it is a sign that being a woman in a place of importance is no longer extraordinary.
author: Ruth Bader Ginsberg

quote: Women forget all the things they don't want to remember  and remember everything they don't want to forget.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: When you're in love  you put up with things that  when you're out of love you cite.
author: Judith Martin

quote: To the timid and hesitating everything is impossible because it seems so.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: Work is either fun or drudgery. It depends on your attitude. I like fun.
author: Colleen C. Barrett

quote: What we see depends mainly on what we look for.
author: John Lubbock

quote: People only see what they are prepared to see.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: For years I wanted to be older  and now I am.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Look for the ridiculous in everything and you find it.
author: Jules Renard

quote: He that seeks trouble always finds it.
author: English proverb

quote: The more wary you are of danger  the more likely you are to meet it.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Lifting as they climb  onward and upward they go  struggling and striving and hoping that the buds and blossoms of their desires may burst into glorious fruition ere long.
author: Mary Church Terrell

quote: We are always paid for our suspicion by finding what we suspect.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The unthankful heart... discovers no mercies  but the thankful heart... will find  in every hour  some heavenly blessings.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: If you are possessed by an idea  you find it expressed everywhere  you even smell it.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: All seems infected that the infected spy  as all looks yellow to the jaundiced eye.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The faultfinder will find faults even in paradise.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Those see nothing but faults that seek for nothing else.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The world is a looking glass and gives back to every man the reflection of his own face. Frown at it and it will in turn look sourly upon you  laugh at it and with it  and it is a jolly  kind companion.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: Life is a mirror and will reflect back to the thinker what he thinks into it.
author: Ernest Holmes

quote: The world is a great mirror. It reflects back to you what you are. If you are loving  if you are friendly  if you are helpful  the world will prove loving and friendly and helpful to you. The world is what you are.
author: Thomas Dreier

quote: The world is like a mirror  frown at it  and it frowns at you. Smile and it smiles  too.
author: Herbert Samuel

quote: If enough people think of a thing and work hard enough at it  I guess it's pretty nearly bound to happen  wind and weather permitting.
author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

quote: If you are going to think black  think positive about it. Don't think down on it  or think it is something in your way. And this way  when you really do want to stretch out and express how beautiful black is  everybody will hear you.
author: Leontyne Price

quote: Our minds can shape the way a thing will be because we act according to our expectations.
author: Federico Fellini

quote: I like living. I have sometimes been wildly  despairingly  acutely miserable  racked with sorrow  but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: A man is literally what he thinks.
author: James Lane Allen

quote: Although none of the rules for becoming alive is valid  it is healthy to keep on formulating them.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts ... take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue and reasonable nature.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: All that a man does outwardly is but the expression and completion of his inward thought. To work effectively  he must think clearly  to act nobly  he must think nobly.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: You cannot escape the results of your thoughts.... Whatever your present environment may be  you will fall  remain or rise with your thoughts  your vision  your ideal. You will become as small as your controlling desire  as great as your dominant aspiration.
author: James Lane Allen

quote: The life each of us lives is the life within the limits of our own thinking. To have life more abundant  we must think in limitless terms of abundance.
author: Thomas Dreier

quote: A man's life is what his thoughts make it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Before a painter puts a brush to his canvas he sees his picture mentally.... If you think of yourself in terms of a painting  what do you see? ... Is the picture one you think worth painting? ... You create yourself in the image you hold in your mind.
author: Thomas Dreier

quote: A man is what he thinks about all day long.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: All that we are is the result of what we have thought. The mind is everything. What we think  we become.
author: Buddha

quote: I believe that if you think about disaster  you will get it. Brood about death and you hasten your demise. Think positively and masterfully with confidence and faith  and life becomes more secure  more fraught with action  richer in achievement and experience.
author: Eddie Rickenbacker

quote: Think you can  think you can't  either way  you'll be right.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Our destiny changes with our thoughts  we shall become what we wish to become  do what we wish to do  when our habitual thoughts correspond with our desires.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Our best friends and our worst enemies are our thoughts. A thought can do us more good than a doctor or a banker or a faithful friend. It can also do us more harm than a brick.
author: Dr. Frank Crane

quote: The way a man's mind runs is the way he is sure to go.
author: Henry B. Wilson

quote: Nothing befalls us that is not of the nature of ourselves. There comes no adventure but wears to our soul the shape of our everyday thoughts.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: The mere apprehension of a coming evil has put many into a situation of the utmost danger.
author: Lucan

quote: The soul contains the event that shall befall it  for the event is only the actualization of its thoughts  and what we pray to ourselves for is always granted.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: If you think it's going to rain  it will.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: As you think  you travel  and as you love  you attract. You are today where your thoughts have brought you  you will be tomorrow where your thoughts take you.
author: James Lane Allen

quote: God will help you if you try  and you can if you think you can.
author: Anna Delaney Peale

quote: To expect defeat is nine-tenths of defeat itself.
author: Francis Marion Crawford

quote: The quality of our expectations determines the quality of our action.
author: Andre Godin

quote: What a man thinks of himself  that is what determines  or rather indicates  his fate.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Man  being made reasonable  and so a thinking creature  there is nothing more worthy of his being than the right direction and employment of his thoughts  since upon this depends both his usefulness to the public  and his own present and future benefit in all respects.
author: William Penn

quote: Great men are they who see that the spiritual is stronger than any material force  that thoughts rule the world.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Never think any oldish thoughts. It's oldish thoughts that make a person old.
author: James A. Farley

quote: They can because they think they can.
author: Virgil

quote: As a man thinketh  so is he  and as a man chooseth  so is he.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Thoughts lead on to purposes  purposes go forth in action  actions form habits  habits decide character  and character fixes our destiny.
author: Tyron Edwards

quote: Keep your thoughts right  for as you think  so are you. Therefore  think only those things that will make the world better  and you unashamed.
author: Henry H. Buckley

quote: Every man is free to rise as far as he's able or willing  but the degree to which he thinks determines the degree to which he'll rise.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: What you think means more than anything else in your life.
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: Baseball is 90 percent mental. The other half is physical.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: The way in which we think of ourselves has everything to do with how our world sees us.
author: Arlene Raven

quote: Be careful of your thoughts  they may become words at any moment.
author: Ira Gassen

quote: The wisdom of all ages and cultures emphasizes the tremendous power our thoughts have over our character and circumstances.
author: Liane Cordes

quote: There comes no adventure but wears to our soul the shape of our everyday thoughts.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: We exaggerate misfortune and happiness alike. We are never either so wretched or so happy as we say we are.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Think of all the beauty that's still left in and around you and be happy!
author: Anne Frank

quote: We are never so happy or so unhappy as we think.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Man is only miserable so far as he thinks himself so.
author: Jacopo Sannazaro

quote: A man's as miserable as he thinks he is.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: The most unhappy of all men is he who believes himself to be so.
author: David Hume

quote: The mind is its own place  and in itself can make a heaven of hell  a hell of heaven.
author: John Milton

quote: All happiness is in the mind.
author: Anonymous

quote: Happiness is not a matter of events  it depends upon the tides of the mind.
author: Alice Meynell

quote: The greater part of our happiness or misery depends on our dispositions  and not our circumstances.
author: Martha Washington

quote: I am happy and content because I think I am.
author: Alain-Rene Lesage

quote: A happy life consists in tranquility of mind.
author: Cicero

quote: The happiest person is the person who thinks the most interesting thoughts.
author: William Lyon Phelps

quote: Unhappiness indicates wrong thinking  just as ill health indicates a bad regimen.
author: Paul Bourget

quote: Happiness does not depend on outward things  but on the way we see them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Happiness will never be any greater than the idea we have of it.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: He is happy that knoweth not himself to be otherwise.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Misery is almost always the result of thinking.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness.
author: Bernard de Fontenelle

quote: It isn't our position  but our disposition  that makes us happy.
author: Anonymous

quote: God prefers your health  and your obedience  to your penance.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: After you're older  two things are possibly more important than any others: health and money.
author: Helen Gurley Brown

quote: The best course was to buy a house across a road from a cemetery and look at it every morning. Reminding yourself where it all ended anyway  you'd never get upset about anything again.
author: Mildred Davis

quote: Some patients I see are actually draining into their bodies the diseased thoughts of their minds.
author: Zachary T. Bercovitz

quote: A sneer is like a flame  it may occasionally be curative because it cauterizes  but it leaves a bitter scar.
author: Margaret Deland

quote: Hate is like acid. It can damage the vessel in which it is stored as well as destroy the object on which it is poured.
author: Ann Landers

quote: The body manifests what the mind harbors.
author: Jerry Augustine

quote: Since the human body tends to move in the direction of its expectations-plus or minus-it is important to know that attitudes of confidence and determination are no less a part of the treatment program than medical science and technology.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: Tragedy had its compensations. Once the worst misfortune occurred  one never worried about the minor ones.
author: Mildred Davis

quote: Give me good health and I'll take care of the rest.
author: Marilyn Home

quote: When people asked  I used to tell them how sick I was. The more I talked about being sick  the worse I got. Finally  I started saying  "I'm getting better." It took a while  but then I started to feel better  too.
author: Michael Hirsch

quote: You can promote your healing by your thinking.
author: James E. Sweeney

quote: Most of the time we think we're sick it's all in the mind.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: My gift is that I'm not beautiful. My career was never about looks. It's about health and being in good shape.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: The pessimist is half-licked before he starts.
author: Thomas A. Buckner

quote: In rejecting secrecy I had also rejected the road to cynicism.
author: Catharine Marshall

quote: An ass may bray a good while before he shakes the stars down.
author: George Eliot

quote: It is healthier to see the good points of others than to analyze our own bad ones.
author: Franchise Sagan

quote: Pessimism is a luxury that a Jew can never afford himself.
author: Golda Meir

quote: Never say anything on the phone that you wouldn't want your mother to hear at your trial.
author: Sydney Biddle Barrows

quote: You can either give in to negative feelings or fight them  and I'm of the belief that you should fight them.
author: Dr. Ruth Westheimer

quote: A critic is someone who never actually goes to the battle  yet who afterwards comes out shooting the wounded.
author: Tyne Daly

quote: They never raised a statue to a critic.
author: Martha Graham

quote: The weak are the most treacherous of us all. They come to the strong and drain them. They are bottomless. They are insatiable. They are always parched and always bitter. They are everyone's concern and like vampires they suck our life's blood.
author: Bette Davis

quote: No one can defeat us unless we first defeat ourselves.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Play not with paradoxes. That caustic which you handle in order to scorch others may happen to sear your own fingers and make them dead to the quality of things.
author: George Eliot

quote: Discussing how old you are is the temple of boredom.
author: Ruth Gordon

quote: You can't be pessimistic  because there are so many things that go wrong every day that if you were to be negative or pessimistic  you'd go out of business.
author: John DePasquale

quote: We criticize and separate ourselves from the process. We've got to jump right in there with both feet.
author: Dolores Huerta

quote: Wit is the salt of conversation  not the food  and few things in the world are more wearying than a sarcastic attitude towards life.
author: Agnes Repplier

quote: You can't pay attention to your mistakes. I made a mistake today  I made a mistake yesterday. I think it's ... very important to ignore the negative.
author: Jerry Rubin

quote: You just can't complain about being alive. It's self-indulgent to be unhappy.
author: Gena Rowland

quote: We can destroy ourselves by cynicism and disillusion  just as affectively as by bombs.
author: Kenneth Clark

quote: One of the most devastating experiences in human life is disillusionment.
author: Art Sisson

quote: The pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity  the optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
author: L. P. Jacks

quote: No pessimist ever discovered the secrets of the stars  or sailed to an uncharted land  or opened a new heaven to the human spirit.
author: Helen Keller

quote: There are people who have an appetite for grief  pleasure is not strong enough and they crave pain. They have mithridatic stomachs which must be fed on poisoned bread  natures so doomed that no prosperity can sooth their ragged and dishevelled desolation.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I don't believe in pessimism.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: If any has a stone to throw It is not I  ever or now.
author: Elinor Wylie

quote: Cynicism is intellectual dandyism.
author: George Meredith

quote: When one door of happiness closes  another opens  but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Do not sit long with a sad friend. When you go to a garden do you look at the weeds? Spend more time with the roses and jasmines.
author: Jelaluddin Rumi

quote: If we are not responsible for the thoughts that pass our doors  we are at least responsible for those we admit and entertain.
author: Charles B. Newcomb

quote: Optimism is an intellectual choice.
author: Diana Schneider

quote: Think of only three things: your God  your family and the Green Bay Packers-in that order.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: You live with your thoughts-so be careful what they are.
author: Eva Arrington

quote: We must dare to think unthinkable thoughts.
author: James W. Fulbright

quote: Politeness is the art of choosing among one's real thoughts.
author: Abel Stevens

quote: Thoughts have power  thoughts are energy. And you can make your world or break it by your own thinking.
author: Susan Taylor

quote: Your imagination has much to do with your life. ... It is for you to decide how you want your imagination to serve you.
author: Philip Conley

quote: A vacant mind invites dangerous inmates  as a deserted mansion tempts wandering outcasts to enter and take up their abode in its desolate apartments.
author: Nicholas Hilliard

quote: Great things are not something accidental  but must certainly be willed.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: Cease to be a drudge  seek to be an artist.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: True revolutions ... restore more than they destroy.
author: Louise Bogan

quote: There are seeds of self-destruction in all of us that will bear only unhappi-ness if allowed to grow.
author: Dorothea Brande

quote: We have seen too much defeatism  too much pessimism  too much of a negative approach.
author: Margo Jones

quote: This is the way of peace-overcome evil with good  and falsehood with truth  and hatred with love.
author: Peace Pilgrim

quote: The evil of the world is made possible by nothing but the sanction you give it.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: If you make fun of bad persons you make yourself beneath them. ... Be kind to bad and good  for you don't know your own heart.
author: Sarah Winnemucca

quote: We have learned that power is a positive force if it is used for positive purposes.
author: Elizabeth Dole

quote: The optimism of a healthy mind is indefatigable.
author: Margery Allingham

quote: If I were to wish for anything  I should not wish for wealth and power  but for the passionate sense of the potential  for the eye which  ever young and ardent  sees the possible . . . what wine is so sparkling  so fragrant  so intoxicating  as possibility!
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: What after all has maintained the human race on this old globe  despite all the calamities of nature and all the tragic failings of mankind  if not the faith in new possibilities and the courage to advocate them?
author: Jane Adams

quote: The basic success orientation is having an optimistic attitude.
author: John DePasquale

quote: Think positively and masterfully  with confidence and faith  and life becomes more secure  more fraught with action  richer in achievement and experience.
author: Eddie Rickenbacker

quote: Am I like the optimist who  while falling ten stories from a building  says at each story  "I'm all right so far"?
author: Gretel Ehrlich

quote: It doesn't hurt to be optimistic. You can always cry later.
author: Lucimar Santos de Lima

quote: The biggest quality in successful people  I think  is an impatience with negative thinking ... my feeling was  even if it's as bad as I think it is  we'll make it work.
author: Edward McCabe

quote: Optimism and humor are the grease and glue of life. Without both of them we would never have survived our captivity.
author: Philip Butler

quote: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Positive thinking is the key to success in business  education  pro football  anything that you can mention. I go out there thinking that I am going to complete every pass.
author: Ron Jaworski

quote: Positive Thinking Is Practical There is in the worst of fortune the best of chances for a happy change.
author: Euripides

quote: Every noble work is at first impossible.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Optimism is essential to achievement and is also the foundation of courage and of true progress.
author: Nicholas Murray Butler

quote: I cannot discover that anyone knows enough to say definitely what is and what is not possible.
author: Henry Ford

quote: I have learned to use the word impossible with the greatest caution.
author: Wernher von Braun

quote: The Wright brothers flew right through the smoke screen of impossibility.
author: Charles Franklin Kettering

quote: On the human chessboard  all moves are possible.
author: Miriam Schiff

quote: In the long run  the pessimist may be proved to be right  but the optimist has a better time on the trip.
author: Daniel L. Reardon

quote: All things are possible until they are proved impossible-and even the impossible may only be so as of now.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: One is not born a genius  one becomes a genius.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: Like begets like  honesty begets honesty  trust  trust  and so on.
author: James F. Bell

quote: Honor begets honor  trust begets trust  faith begets faith  and hope is the mainspring of life.
author: Henry L. Stimson

quote: Mankind's greatest gift... is that we have free choice.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: If you haven't been happy very young  you can still be happy later on  but it's much harder. You need more luck.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: Events  circumstances  etc.  have their origin in ourselves. They spring from seeds which we have sown.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Hope is like a road in the country  there was never a road  but when many people walk on it  the road comes into existence.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: If fear is cultivated it will become stronger  if faith is cultivated it will achieve mastery.
author: John Paul Jones

quote: The process of maturing is an art to be learned  an effort to be sustained. By the age of fifty  you have made yourself what you are  and if it is good  it is better than your youth.
author: Marya Mannes

quote: A human being fashions his consequences as surely as he fashions his goods or his dwelling. Nothing that he says  thinks or does is without consequences.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: We create our fate every day ... most of the ills we suffer from are directly traceable to our own behavior.
author: Henry Miller

quote: It seems to me probably that any one who has a series of intolerable positions to put up with must have been responsible for them to some extent... they have contributed to it by impatience or intolerance  or brusqueness-or some provocation.
author: Robert Hugh Benson

quote: If we live good lives  the times are also good. As we are  such are the times.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Opportunities multiply as they are seized  they die when neglected. Life is a long line of opportunities.
author: John Wicker

quote: I have found that if you love life  life will love you back.
author: Arthur Rubinstein

quote: A man is a method  a progressive arrangement  a selecting principle  gathering his like unto him wherever he goes. What you are comes to you.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Thousands upon thousands are yearly brought into a state of real poverty by their great anxiety not to be thought poor.
author: William Cobbett

quote: We are made kind by being kind.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: The world has a way of giving what is demanded of it. If you are frightened and look for failure and poverty  you will get them  no matter how hard you may try to succeed. Lack of faith in yourself  in what life will do for you  cuts you off from the good things of the world. Expect victory and you make victory. Nowhere is this truer than in business that is  where bravery and faith bring both material and spiritual rewards.
author: Preston Bradley

quote: Choice is the essence of what I believe it is to be human.
author: Liv Ullmann

quote: Kindness gives birth to kindness.
author: Sophocles

quote: We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Once a human being has arrived on this earth  communication is the largest single factor determining what kinds of relationships he makes with others and what happens to him in the world about him.
author: Virginia Satir

quote: Man does not simply exist  but always decides what his existence will be  what he will become in the next moment.
author: Viktor Frankl

quote: You end up as you deserve. In old age you must put up with the face  the friends  the health  and the children you have earned.
author: Fay Weldon

quote: Liberty cannot be caged into a charter and handed on ready-made to the next generation. Each generation must recreate liberty for its own times. Whether or not we establish freedom rests with ourselves.
author: Florence Ellinwood Allen

quote: I am one of those people who are blessed ... with a nature which has to interfere. If I see a thing that needs doing I do it.
author: Margery Allingham

quote: The principle of life is that life responds by corresponding  your life becomes the thing you have decided it shall be.
author: Raymond Charles Barker

quote: If we choose to be no more than clods of clay  then we shall be used as clods of clay for braver feet to tread on.
author: Marie Corelli

quote: Preparing for the worst is an activity I have taken up since I turned thirty-five  and the worst actually began to happen.
author: Delia Ephron

quote: If you prepare for old age  old age comes sooner.
author: Anonymous

quote: It is no use blaming the men-we made them what they are-and now it is up to us to try and make ourselves-the makers of men-a little more responsible.
author: Nancy Astor

quote: Lead me not into temptation  I can find the way myself.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: Believe there is a great power silently working all things for good  behave yourself and never mind the rest.
author: Beatrix Potter

quote: I made the decision. I'm accountable.
author: Janet Reno

quote: What we prepare for is what we shall get.
author: William Graham Sumner

quote: We make our own criminals  and their crimes are congruent with the national culture we all share. It has been said that a people get the kind of political leadership they deserve. I think they also get the kinds of crime and criminals they themselves bring into being.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: If one asks for success and prepares for failure  he will get the situation he has prepared for.
author: Florence Scovel Shinn

quote: We are accountable only to ourselves for what happens to us in our lives.
author: Mildred Newman

quote: I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took an excuse.
author: Florence Nightingale

quote: The world has a way of giving what is demanded of it. If you are frightened and look for failure and poverty  you will get them  no matter how hard you may try to succeed. Lack of faith in yourself  in what life will do for you  cuts you off from the good things of the world. Expect victory and you make victory. Nowhere is this truer than in business life  where bravery and faith bring both material and spiritual rewards.
author: Preston Bradley

quote: Carry on  carry on  for the men and boys are gone  But the furrow shan't lie fallow while the women carry on.
author: Janet Begbie

quote: The willingness to accept responsibility for one's own life is the source from which self-respect springs.
author: Joan Didion

quote: If you don't like the way the world is  you change it. You have an obligation to change it. You just do it one step at a time.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein.
author: Bible

quote: Debt is a trap which man sets and baits himself  and then deliberately gets into.
author: Josh Billings

quote: It is not our circumstances that c reate our discontent or contentment. It is us.
author: Vivian Greene

quote: Fortunately the family is a human institution: humans made it and humans can change it.
author: Shere Hite

quote: Any committee is only as good as the most knowledgeable  determined  and vigorous person on it. There must be somebody who provides the flame.
author: Lady Bird Johnson

quote: Self-image sets the boundaries of individual accomplishment.
author: Maxwell Maltz

quote: If you expect nothing  you're apt to be surprised. You'll get it.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: My father instilled in me that if you don't see things happening the way you want them to  you get out there and make them happen.
author: Susan Powter

quote: To heal ourselves we also have to heal society.
author: Riane Eisler

quote: Here is where some entrepreneurs fail. They are filled with creative juices and total commitment to their business  but too often they don't understand that they must also be managers  administrators  even gofers-at least for a while.
author: Lillian Vernon

quote: A voice is a human gift  it should be cherished and used  to utter as fully human speech as possible. Powerlessness and silence go together.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Persistent prophecy is a familiar way of assuring the event.
author: George R. Gissing

quote: The words "I am ..." are potent words  be careful what you hitch them to. The thing you're claiming has a way of reaching back and claiming you.
author: A. L. Kitselman

quote: A word after a word after a word is power.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: A person who can write a long letter with ease  cannot write ill.
author: Jane Austen

quote: If you keep saying things are going to be bad  you have a good chance of being a prophet.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: Our lives preserved. How it was  and how it will be. Passing it along in the relay. That is what I work to do: to produce stories that save our lives.
author: Toni Cade Bambara

quote: When people asked  I used to tell them how sick I was. The more I talked about being sick  the worse I got. Finally  I started saying  "I'm getting better." It took a while  but then I started to feel better  too.
author: Michael Hirsch

quote: Journal writing is a voyage to the interior.
author: Christina Baldwin

quote: To know how to say what others only know how to think is what makes men poets or sages  and to dare to say what others only dare to think makes men martyrs or reformers-or both.
author: Elizabeth Charles

quote: My voice is still the same  and this makes me beside myself with Joy! Oh  mon Dieu  when I think what I might be able to do with it!
author: Jenny Lind

quote: Men will get no more out of life than they put into it.
author: William J. H. Boetcker

quote: He who sows courtesy reaps friendship  and he who plants kindness gathers love.
author: Saint Basil

quote: Who soweth good seed shall surely reap  The year grows rich as it groweth old  And life's latest sands are its sands of gold!
author: Julia Dorr

quote: Whatsoever a man soweth  that shall he also reap.
author: Bible

quote: There is a very real relationship  both quantitatively and qualitatively  between what you contribute and what you get out of this world.
author: Oscar Hammerstein II

quote: If a man plants melons he will reap melons  if he sows beans  he will reap beans.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: 1 Give to the world the best you have I and the best will come back to you.
author: Madeline Bridges

quote: Trust men and they will be true to you  treat them greatly and they will show themselves great.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: While you don't need a formal written contract before you get married  I think it's important for both partners to spell out what they expect from each other.... There are always plenty of surprises-and lots of give and take-once you're married.
author: Muriel Fox

quote: We awaken in others the same attitude of mind we hold toward them.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: He who has not faith in others shall find no faith in them.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: Any man will usually get from other men just what he is expecting of them. If he is looking for friendship he will likely receive it. If his attitude is that of indifference  it will beget indifference. And if a man is looking for a fight  he will in all likelihood be accommodated in that.
author: John Richelsen

quote: A man would prefer to come home to an unmade bed and a happy woman than to a neatly made bed and an angry woman.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: They say  "You can't give a smile away  it always comes back." The same is true of a kind word or a conversation starter. What goes around  comes around.
author: Susan RoAne

quote: Revolve your world around the customer and more customers will revolve around you.
author: Heather Williams

quote: Charm is the ability to make someone else think that both of you are pretty wonderful.
author: Kathleen Winsor

quote: Power without [the people's] confidence is nothing.
author: Catherine the Great

quote: To make the world a friendly place  one must show it a friendly face.
author: James Whitcomb Riley

quote: People are not going to love you unless you love them.
author: Pat Carroll

quote: Getting people to like you is merely the other side of liking them.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: If you would be loved  love and be lovable.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: People  by and large  will relate to the image you project.
author: Anonymous
